jugumento: <entryFree id="n25323" type="main" key="ju^gu_mento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭgūmento</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">jŭgāmento</orth>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. jugo</etym>, <sense id="n25323.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fasten together</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jugumentum: <entryFree id="n25324" type="main" key="ju^gu_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭgūmentum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">jŭgām-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25324.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cross-beam, lintel, threshold</hi> (ante-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jugurtha: <entryFree id="n25325" type="main" key="Ju^gurtha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jŭgurtha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25325.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the nephew and successor of Micipsa, king of Numidia, conquered by Marius in the war with the Romans;</hi> v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 5</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 1</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n25325.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Jŭgurthīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Jugurtha, Jugurthan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjuratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:23" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:3:45" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 3, 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jugus: <entryFree id="n25326" type="main" key="ju^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. jugo</etym>, <sense id="n25326.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging together</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vasa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
juleus: <entryFree id="n25327" type="main" key="Ju_le^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jūlĕus</orth>, v. Iuleus.</entryFree>
juliacum: <entryFree id="n25328" type="main" key="Juliacum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Juliacum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n25328.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Gallia Belgica</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Juliers</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
julianus: <entryFree id="n25329" type="main" key="Ju_li^a_nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jūlĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Julius</etym>, <sense id="n25329.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Julius Cæsar, Julian</hi>: vectigalia, i. e. <hi rend="ital">which were introduced by Julius Cæsar</hi>, M. Anton. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:15:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 15, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiatores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. ad Oet. 9</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Jūlĭā-ni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">soldiers who were on the side of Cæsar in the civil war</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:75" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 75</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25330" type="main" key="Ju_li^a_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jūlĭānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25330.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Julian, a Roman proper name</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25330.1" n="I" level="1"> M. Didius Severus Julianus Augustus, <hi rend="ital">a Roman emperor, who was put to death after a reign of</hi> 66 <hi rend="ital">days</hi>, A. D. 193.—</sense><sense id="n25330.2" n="II" level="1"> Julianus Augustus Apostata, <hi rend="ital">an emperor who turned from Christianity to paganism</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
julias: <entryFree id="n25331" type="main" key="Ju_li^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jūlĭas</orth>, <itype>adis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n25331.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Galilee</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 15, 15, § 71</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
juliensis: <entryFree id="n25332" type="main" key="Ju_li^ensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jūlĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Julius</etym>, <sense id="n25332.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Julius, Julian</hi>, an appellation given to cities or colonies, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 5, 8, § 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:130" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 19, 23, § 130</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
juliobriga: <entryFree id="n25333" type="main" key="Ju_li^o_^bri^ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jūlĭō^brĭga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n25333.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Hispania Tarraconensis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 27</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Jūlĭō^brĭgensis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an inhabitant of Juliobriga</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 20, 34, § 110</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
julis: <entryFree id="n25334" type="main" key="ju_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">iūlis</orth>), <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n25334.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of rockfish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 9, 31, § 94</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
julius: <entryFree id="n25335" type="main" key="Ju_li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jūlĭus</orth> (in poets also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭūlĭus</orth>, quadrisyll.), a, <sense id="n25335.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., name of a Roman</hi> gens; <cit><quote lang="la">especially celebrated, C. Julius Cæsar and his adopted son, C. Julius Cæsar (Octavianus) Augustus: unde domus Teucros Julia tangit avos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:40" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templa, i. e. curia Julia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:5:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 5, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">edicta,</quote> <trans><tr>decrees and laws of Augustus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:15:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 15, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12, 47</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25335.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: Julius mensis (or, <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, Julius), <hi rend="ital">the month of July</hi>, which was previously<pb n="1017" /> <cb n="JUNG" />  called Quinctilis: <cit><quote lang="la">fervens Julius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:62" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 62</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
julus: <entryFree id="n25336" type="main" key="Ju_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jūlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. 2. Iulus.</entryFree>
jumentarius: <entryFree id="n25337" type="main" key="ju_menta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūmentārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>jumentum</etym>, <sense id="n25337.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to draught-cattle</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">mola,</quote> <trans><tr>worked by draught-cattle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:26:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 26, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contubernium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 222, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jumentum: <entryFree id="n25338" type="main" key="ju_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>contr. from jugimentum, from jungo</etym>: <sense id="n25338.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">jumenta ducunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 27</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">a beast used for drawing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">carrying, draught-cattle, a beast of bur-</hi> den, esp. <hi rend="ital">a horse, mule</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">ass</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum illam curru vehi jus esset, morarenturque jumenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:47:113" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 47, 113</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jumento nihil opus est, i. e. equo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sarcinaria,</quote> <trans><tr>beasts of burden</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non jumenta solum, sed elephanti etiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectus jumentis junctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Tim. 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Tim. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servi ut taceant, jumenta loquentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:103" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 103</bibl></cit>.—Freq. opp. boves: <cit><quote lang="la">jumenta bovesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 12, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jumentis legatis boves non continentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 6, 74</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sing. collect.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultur, jumento et canibus relictis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:77" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 77</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25338.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A carriage, vehicle</hi>, XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:28" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
juncetum: <entryFree id="n25339" type="main" key="junce_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">juncētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>juncus</etym>, <sense id="n25339.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place full of rushes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:8:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 8, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
junceus: <entryFree id="n25340" type="main" key="junce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">juncĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n25340.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Made of rushes, rush-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sporta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:870" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 870</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 14, 49, § 84</bibl></cit>.— Comically: nam mihi jam intus potione junceā onerabo gulam, <hi rend="ital">with a rush-drink</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">with a rope of rushes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 56</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25340.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Like a rush</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba caule junceo pedali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 47, § 85</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25340.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">slim, slender</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam etsi bona'st natura, reddunt curatura junceam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 25</bibl></cit> (Fleck.): pectora, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 3, 132: <cit><quote lang="la">proceritas columnarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 7, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
juncinus: <entryFree id="n25341" type="main" key="junci^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">juncĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made from rushes, rush-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 7, 7, § 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
juncosus: <entryFree id="n25342" type="main" key="junco_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">juncōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25342.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of rushes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 6, 8, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 231</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
junctim: <entryFree id="n25343" type="main" key="junctim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">junctim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. jungo <sense id="n25343.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
junctio: <entryFree id="n25344" type="hapax" key="junctio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">junctio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>jungo</etym>, <sense id="n25344.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a joining, uniting, union</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:29:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 29, 71</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
junctor: <entryFree id="n25345" type="main" key="junctor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">junctor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25345.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a harnesser</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:203" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 203 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
junctura: <entryFree id="n25346" type="main" key="junctu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">junctūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25346.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a joining, uniting; a juncture, joint</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n25346.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">boum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2</bibl></cit> 22: <cit><quote lang="la">genuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:823" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 823</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut umor teneat juncturas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the commissures, joints</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 40, 79, § 214</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrato saxo murus ducatur juncturis quam longissimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laterum juncturas fibula mordet,</quote> <trans><tr>the two ends of the girdle which meet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 274</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25346.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25346.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Plur., trappings, mountings</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">data et vehicula cum mulabus, et mulionibus, cum juncturis argenteis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Ver. 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25346.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A team</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">carruca cum junctura legata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 6, 91</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25346.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a connection</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">generis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>relationship, consanguinity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 135</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25346.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n25346.7" n="1" level="3"> Rhet.: <cit><quote lang="la">in omni compositione tria sunt necessaria, ordo, junctura, numerus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 32</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25346.8" n="2" level="3"> Gram., <hi rend="ital">a joining together, compounding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixeris egregie, notum si callida verbum Reddiderit junctura novum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
junctus: <entryFree id="n25347" type="main" key="junctus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">junctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from jungo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25348" type="main" key="junctus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">junctus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>jungo</etym>, <sense id="n25348.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a joining</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Carinarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=47" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 47</bibl></cit>, Müll.</sense></entryFree>
juncus: <entryFree id="n25349" type="main" key="juncus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">juncus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rush</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25349.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">murteta juncis circumvincire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palustres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:336" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 336</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acutā cuspide junci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:299" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 299</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25349.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A twig resembling a rush</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 46, § 72</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jungo: <entryFree id="n25350" type="main" key="jungo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jungo</orth>, <itype>nxi, nctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. jug, junagmi, to unite; juk, joined; Goth. juk; O. H. Germ. joh, joch; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">zug, zeu/gnumi, zugo/s, zugo/n</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n25350.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to join</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unite together, connect, attach, fasten, yoke, harness</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25350.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25350.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n25350.3" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Narcissum et florem anethi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontes et propugnacula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 9, 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemoris carentia sensu robora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. G. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gradus,</quote> <trans><tr>to close the ranks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:372" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 372</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <trans><tr>to heap up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:198" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostia,</quote> <trans><tr>to shut</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:105" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 105</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">junctas quatere fenestras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 25, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oscula,</quote> <trans><tr>to exchange</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:357" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 357</bibl></cit>; cf. <cb n="JUNG" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:5:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 5, 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">da jungere dextram,</quote> <trans><tr>to clasp</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:697" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 697</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur dextrae jungere dextram non datur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 408</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quas junximus hospitio dextras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 83</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">11, 165: duos sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juncto ponte milites transmittit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 49</bibl></cit>.—So with <hi rend="ital">abl. of means</hi> or <hi rend="ital">manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ticinum ponte,</quote> <trans><tr>to span</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:45:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 45, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnem ponte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 24, 21, § 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratibus flumen,</quote> <trans><tr>to bridge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:47:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 47, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui biduo vix locum rate jungendo flumini inventum tradunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:47:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 47, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo omnia vallo et fossa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plumbum nigrum albo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 5, 30, § 94</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nam calamus cera jungitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:32" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illos defendit numerus junctaeque umbone phalanges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:46" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erga juncta est mihi foedere dextra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompei acies junxerat in seriem nexis umbonibus arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:453" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 453</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n25350.4" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">dat. of indir. object</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc opus ad turrim hostium admovent, ut aedificio jungatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humano capiti cervicem equinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortua corpora vivis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:485" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 485</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">his tignis contraria duo juncta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 17, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se Romanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:49:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 49, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:80:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 80, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">socia arma Rutulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victores Germani juncturi se Pannoniis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervicem meam amplexui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 86</bibl></cit> dub. (Büch., vinxit amplexu): <cit><quote lang="la">dextra dextrae jungitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:447" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 447</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:408" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 408</bibl> supra: <cit><quote lang="la">aeri aes plumbo fit uti jungatur ab albo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1079" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1079</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juncta est vena arteriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Comius incensum calcaribus equum jungit equo Quadrati,</quote> <trans><tr>drives against</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. C. 8:48" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. C. 8, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25350.5" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">inter se</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tigna bina inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxime autem corpora inter se juncta permanent, cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:45:115" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 45, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disparibus calamis inter se junctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:712" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 712</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltus duo alti inter se juncti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25350.6" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Bruto Cassioque vires suas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:65:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 65, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones se cum Caesare juncturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:110:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 110, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat cum pede pes junctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lecto mecum junctus in uno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 13, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digitis medio cum pollice junctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:433" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 433</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua cum subjecta parte juncta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 12, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25350.7" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n25350.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To harness, yoke, attach</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25350.9" n="(a)" level="5"> Of animals: angues ingentes alites juncti jugo, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:19:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 19, 27</bibl> (Trag. v. 397 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">junge pares,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in pairs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 169</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyneg. 263</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec jungere tauros norant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:316" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 316</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currus et quatuor equos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grypes equis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 8, 27</bibl></cit> Forbig.: <cit><quote lang="la">curru jungit Halaesus Equos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:724" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 724</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leones ad currum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 21, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulis e proximo pistrino ad vehiculum junctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25350.10" n="(b)" level="5"> Of a vehicle (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">reda equis juncta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neve (mulier) juncto vehiculo veheretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juncta vehicula, pleraque onusta, mille admodum capiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:65:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 65, 3</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n25350.11" n="2" level="3"> Of wounds, etc., <hi rend="ital">to join, bring together, unite, heal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego vulnera doctum jungere Etiona petam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:733" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 733</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parotidas suppuratas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 206" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 206</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oras (tumoris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oras vulneris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:4:23 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 4, 23 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n25350.12" n="3" level="3"> Of lands, territories, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">juncta pharetratis Sarmatis ora Getis,</quote> <trans><tr>adjoining</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:110" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 110</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">juncta Aquilonibus Arctos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (campis) junctae paludes erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:5:6" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 5, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:110:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 110, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundos Apuliae,</quote> <trans><tr>to add, join to</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longos jungere fines agrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 167</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25350.13" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To connect in time, cause to follow immediately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum diei noctem pervigilem junxisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:13:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 13, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnum morti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidit hic annus Ventidium consularem praetextam jungentem praetoriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:65:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 65, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla natio tam mature consino belli bellum junxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:110:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 110, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">junge, puer, cyathos, atque enumerare labora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:5:10" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laborem difficilius est repetere quam jungere,</quote> <trans><tr>to resume than to continue</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 9, 10</bibl></cit>.—So of pronunciation: <cit><quote lang="la">si jungas (opp. interpunctis quibusdam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:108" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 108</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25350.14" n="5" level="3"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg>, of troops, an army, etc., <hi rend="ital">to join, unite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum juncti essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:37" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum Pompei sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:80:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 80, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">junctis exercitious,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:113:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 113, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum collegae se junxisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:1:9" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:ib. 1:2:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ajacem naves suas Atheniensibus junxisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 40</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25350.15" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To add, give in addition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">commoda praeterea jungentur multa caducis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:89" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 89</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25350.16" n="7" level="3"> In mal. part.: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:464" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 464</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpia corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 9, 134</bibl></cit>: tu mihi <cb n="JUNO" /> juncta toro, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:511" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 511</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 408</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si jungitur ulla Ursidio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:41" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:448" default="NO">6, 448</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Venerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9:76" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 9, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 353</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 407</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n25350.17" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25350.18" n="A" level="2"> In gen., of abstract things, <hi rend="ital">to bring together, join, unite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum hominibus nostris consuetudines, amicitias, res rationesque jungebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem naturam, quae non solitaria sit ... sed cum alio juncta atque conexa, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:11:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 11, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an virtus et voluptas inter se jungi copularique possint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:51:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 51, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientiam junctam habere eloquentiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 35, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indignationem conquestioni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:11:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 11, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insignis improbitas et scelere juncta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:58:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 58, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plura crimina junguntur,</quote> <trans><tr>are combined</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:4:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 4, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25350.19" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n25350.20" n="1" level="3"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">to join, unite, bring together, associate</hi>, in love, marriage, relationship, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum impari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum pare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:98" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus filiam secum matrimonio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:3:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tibi legitimis pactam junctamque tabellis non es amaturus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:200" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juncta puella viro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:682" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 682</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:284" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 284</bibl>. —Of animals, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Appulis jungentur capreae lupis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:33:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 33, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">variis albae junguntur columbac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unaque nos sibi operā amicos junget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quos certus amor junxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Geminum mecum tua in me beneficia junxerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer puero junctus amicitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:3:12" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 3, 12</bibl></cit>.—Esp., of a treaty, alliance, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">si populus Romanus foedere jungeretur regi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:4:24" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 15, 4, 24</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n25350.21" n="2" level="3"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">to make by joining, enter into</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem cum Aenea, deinde adfinitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nova foedera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Hispanis amicitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:5:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 43, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">societatem cum eo metu potentiae ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 22, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedus cum eo amicitiamque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:33" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juncta societas Hannibali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jungendae societatis gratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:4:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 20, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25350.22" n="3" level="3"> Of words, etc., <hi rend="ital">to join, unite</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25350.23" n="(a)" level="5"> Esp., gram. t. t.: verba jungere, <hi rend="ital">to make by joining, to compound</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jungitur verbum ex corrupto et integro, ut malevolus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:68" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in jungendo aut in derivando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 31</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">juncta verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:56:186" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 56, 186</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:15:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 15, 53</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25350.24" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To connect</hi> so as to sound agreeably: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum interest ... verba eadem qua compositione vel in textu jungantur vel in fine claudantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 15</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">junc-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">joined, united, connected, associated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in opere male juncto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 9, 17</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa fuit propior et cum exitu junctior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:16:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 16, 36</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">junctissimus illi comes,</quote> <trans><tr>most attached</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principum prosperis et alii fruantur: adversae ad junctissimos pertineant,</quote> <trans><tr>their nearest of kin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 52</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
junianus: <entryFree id="n25351" type="main" key="Ju_ni^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jūnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Junius</etym>, <sense id="n25351.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Junius, Junian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 25, 30, § 103</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
juniculus: <entryFree id="n25352" type="main" key="ju_ni^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūnĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25352.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an old vine-branch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 182</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
junior: <entryFree id="n25353" type="main" key="ju_ni^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūnĭor</orth>, v. juvenis.</entryFree>
junipereus: <entryFree id="n25354" type="main" key="ju_ni^pe^re^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūnĭpĕrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>juniperus</etym>, <sense id="n25354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of juniper</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. de Cond. Agr. p. 4</bibl> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
juniperus: <entryFree id="n25355" type="main" key="ju_ni^pe^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūnĭpĕrus</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">jūnĭpĭrus</orth>, in Plin. passim), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n25355.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the juniper-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 31, 51, § 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:73" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 18, 30, § 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 76</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
junius: <entryFree id="n25356" type="main" key="Ju_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jūnĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n25356.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens: e. g. M. and D. Junius Brutus.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n25356.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Jūnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Junian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">familia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <trans><tr>proposed by Junius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 9, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 16, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensis,</quote> <trans><tr>the sixth month, June</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 2, 6</bibl></cit>. —Esp., as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Jūnĭus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 21, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:88" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 88</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
junix: <entryFree id="n25357" type="main" key="ju_nix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūnix</orth>, or uncontr. <orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭvĕnix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>juvenix</etym>, <sense id="n25357.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a young cow, a calf, heifer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot tibi cum in flammas junicum omenta liquescant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:47" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 47</bibl></cit>.—In the form juvenix, of a maiden (cf.: <foreign lang="greek">da/malis</foreign>, juvenca): <cit><quote lang="la">quam mox horsum ad stabulum juvenix recipiat se pabulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 38</bibl></cit> Ritschl. dub. (MSS. juvenis).</sense></entryFree>
juno: <entryFree id="n25358" type="main" key="Ju_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jūno</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n25358.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess Juno, daughter of Saturn, sister and wife of Jupiter, and the guardian deity of women; as the foundress of marriage, she is also called</hi> pronuba Juno; <hi rend="ital">and as the protecting goddess of lying-in women</hi>, Juno Lucina, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 7, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:27:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 27, 68</bibl>: prima et Tellus et pronuba Juno dant signum, Verg. <pb n="1018" /> <cb n="JURA" /> A. 4, 166.—</sense><sense id="n25358.1" n="B" level="2"> Juno inferna or infera, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Proserpine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 138</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:1:147" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 1, 147</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">or, Averna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 114</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">or, profunda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Proserp. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">or, Stygia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:526" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 526</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25358.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. in phrases; <cit><quote lang="la">stella Junonis,</quote> <trans><tr>the planet Venus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 8, 6, § 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs Junonis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Argos</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 14, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per Junonem matrem familias jurare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 201</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">Junonis sacra ferre,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to walk at a slow and measured pace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25358.3" n="B" level="2"> Comically transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mea Juno, non decet esse te tam tristem tuo Jovi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>my wife</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ni nanctus Venerem essem, hanc Junonem ducerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: ejuno as <pos>interj.</pos> like ecastor, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 183</bibl> P.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n25358.4" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Jūnōnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Juno</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the month of June</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:63" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 63</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25358.5" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Jūnōnĭcŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>com.</gen> <etym>Junocolo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a worshipper of Juno</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Adde Junonicolas Faliscos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:49" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25358.6" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Jūnōnĭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Juno-gigno</etym>, <hi rend="ital">Junoborn</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Vulcan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 173</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25358.7" n="4" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Jū-nōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Juno, Junonian</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">hospitia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Carthage, where Juno was worshipped</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:671" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1,671</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Samos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ales,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the peacock</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:6:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 6, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">custos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Argus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:678" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 678</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>June, sacred to Juno</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hebe,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the daughter of Juno</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:400" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 400</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:231" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 231</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stella,</quote> <trans><tr>the planet Venus</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Mund. p. 58, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insula,</quote> <trans><tr>one of the Fortunate Isles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 32, 37, § 202</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
juppiter: <entryFree id="n25359" type="main" key="Ju_ppi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jūppĭter</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Jūpĭter</orth>; in all good MSS. double <sense id="n25359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">p;</hi> v. Wagner, Orthogr. Vergl. s. h. v.), Jŏvis (<case>nom.</case> Jovis, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 42</bibl>; Ann. v. 64 Vahl.), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Jovis-pater; Jovis for Djovis, kindred to Sanscr. dyō, splendere; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*zeu/s</foreign>; cf. Bopp. Gloss. p. 177, a</etym>, <hi rend="ital">Jupiter</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Jove, a son of Saturn, brother and husband of Juno, the chief god among the Romans;</hi> corresp. to the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*zeu/s</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:26:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 26, 64</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 21, 53</bibl>: Juppiter pater, old formula ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 18</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovis satelles,</quote> <trans><tr>the eagle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:47:106" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 47, 106</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Jovis ales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:420" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 420</bibl></cit>.—As the god of omens, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">te prodigiali Iovi conprecatam oportuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 108</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: Jovem lapidem jurare, said of one who swore by Jupiter (holding in one hand a knife with which he pierced the sacrificial sow, and in the other hand a stone); <cit><quote lang="la">of gossips: sciunt quod Juno fabulata'st cum Jove,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 171</bibl></cit>; Paul. ex Fest. s v. lapidem, p. 115 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:21:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 21, 4</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">Varro trecentos Joves (sive Juppiteres dicendum) introducit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 14</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, trop.: repente ut emoriantur humani Joves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 5, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Joves quoque plures in priscis Graecorum litteris invenimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:16:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 16, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25359.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25359.2" n="A" level="2"> As the god of heaven, his name is freq. used by the poets as i. q. <hi rend="ital">Heaven, sky, air</hi>: aspice hoc sublimen candens, quem invocant omnes Jovem, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:25:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 25, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chrysippus disputat, aethera esse eum, quem homines Jovem appellarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:15:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 15, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub Jove frigido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 22, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metuendus, i. e. pluvius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:419" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 419</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hibernus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:26" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub Jove pars durat,</quote> <trans><tr>in the open air</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:527" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 527</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci,</quote> <trans><tr>the temperature</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:707" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 707</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25359.3" n="B" level="2"> Juppiter Stygius, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Pluto</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:638" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 638</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">terrestris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 20</bibl></cit>; of <hi rend="ital">the planet Jupiter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 207</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25359.4" n="C" level="2"> As an exclamation of surprise, i. q. our <hi rend="ital">My heavens! good heavens!</hi> Juppiter! estne illic Charinus? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jura: <entryFree id="n25360" type="main" key="Ju_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Jūres</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:197" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 39, 76, § 197</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25360.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chain of mountains extending from the Rhine to the Rhone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 2</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Jūren-sis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Mount Jura</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
juramentum: <entryFree id="n25361" type="main" key="ju_ra_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūrāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>juro</etym>, <sense id="n25361.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an oath</hi> (post-class. for jusjurandum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:3:25" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 3, 25</bibl>: praestare, <hi rend="ital">to take an oath, to swear</hi>, Cod. 2, 56, 4.</sense></entryFree>
jurandum: <entryFree id="n25362" type="main" key="ju_randum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūrandum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25362.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an oath</hi> [anteclass. for jusjurandum): <cit><quote lang="la">abi quaerere ubi jurando tuo satis sit praesidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 26</bibl></cit> (dub.; al. juri-jurando).</sense></entryFree>
juratio: <entryFree id="n25363" type="main" key="ju_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25363.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a swearing, an oath</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 6, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jurativus: <entryFree id="n25364" type="main" key="ju_ra_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūrātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25364.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging<cb n="JURI" />  to an oath</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">adverbia,</quote> <trans><tr>adverbs of swearing</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1020</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
jurato: <entryFree id="n25365" type="main" key="ju_ra_to_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūrātō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. juro.</entryFree>
jurator: <entryFree id="n25366" type="main" key="ju_ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>juro</etym>, <sense id="n25366.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a swearer</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25366.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">falsus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 19, § 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25366.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">an assistant of the censor, one who received the sworn returns of tax-payers</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">census quom sum, juratori recte rationem dedi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 30</bibl></cit> (38); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. prol. 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:44:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 44, 2</bibl>; Symm. Or. pro Synes. 1.—</sense><sense id="n25366.3" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of the audience, as judges of a play: <cit><quote lang="la">vos juratores estis, quaeso, operam date,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
juratorius: <entryFree id="n25367" type="main" key="ju_ra_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūrātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>jurator</etym>, <sense id="n25367.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">confirmed by an oath, juratory</hi> (postclass.): cautio, Cod. 12, 19, 12.</sense></entryFree>
juratus: <entryFree id="n25368" type="main" key="ju_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. juro <sense id="n25368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
jureconsultus: <entryFree id="n25369" type="main" key="ju_re^consultus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūrĕconsultus</orth>, v. jurisconsultus.</entryFree>
jurejuro: <entryFree id="n25370" type="main" key="ju_re^ju_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūrĕ-jūro</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>2. jus-juro</etym>, <sense id="n25370.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to swear</hi>, only in doubtful passage: <cit><quote lang="la">praetores ambo in eadem verba jurejurarunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 15, 10</bibl></cit> (better jure jurarunt; Weissenb. jurarunt).</sense></entryFree>
jureperitus: <entryFree id="n25371" type="main" key="ju_re^pe^ri_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūrĕ-pĕrītus</orth>, v. jurisperitus.</entryFree>
jureus: <entryFree id="n25372" type="spur" key="ju_re^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, false read. for jus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 15</bibl>, v. Ritschl ad h. l.</entryFree>
jurgatio: <entryFree id="n25373" type="gloss" key="jurga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jurgātĭo</orth>, <itype>juris actio</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=103" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 103</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
jurgatorius: <entryFree id="n25374" type="main" key="jurga_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jurgātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>jurgo</etym>, <sense id="n25374.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">quarrelsome</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vocis sonus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jurgatrix: <entryFree id="n25375" type="main" key="jurga_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jurgātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25375.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a quarrelsome woman</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 117, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jurgiosus: <entryFree id="n25376" type="main" key="jurgi^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jurgĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>jurgium</etym>, <sense id="n25376.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">quarrelsome</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mulier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:17:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facundia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:9:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 19, 9, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jurgium: <entryFree id="n25377" type="main" key="jurgi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jurgĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>jurgo</etym>, <sense id="n25377.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a quarrel, strife, dispute, altercation, contention</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">jurgio tandem uxorem abegi ab janua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam jurgio enicabit, si intro rediero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">benevolorum concertatio, non lis inimicorum, jurgium dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:8:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 4, 8, 8</bibl></cit> (ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 430</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">in jurgio respondere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimum quemque jurgio lacessere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quempiam jurgio invadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petulantibus jurgiis illudere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurgia jactare,</quote> <trans><tr>to quarrel</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecum jurgia nectere,</quote> <trans><tr>engage in mutual strife</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per jurgia dicere aliquid,</quote> <trans><tr>in the heat of a dispute</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:11:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurgia prima sonare incipiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:51" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterna jurgia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:268" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 268</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 44, 89, § 239</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erumpere in jurgia,</quote> <trans><tr>to break out into railing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:2:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 10, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurgio aliquem corripere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter Helvidium et Eprium acre jurgium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vixit cum uxore sine jurgio,</quote> <trans><tr>without a quarrel</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25377.1" n="II" level="1"> Law t. t. <hi rend="ital">A legal dispute, a separation</hi> between husband and wife (cf. divortium): <cit><quote lang="la">quod si non divortium sed jurgium fuit, dos ejusdem matrimonii manebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:3:31" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 3, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jurgo: <entryFree id="n25378" type="main" key="jurgo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jurgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum</itype> (ante-class. jurigo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 9</bibl>; Brix ad Trin. 1, 2, 30), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n25378.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [from jus, not a compound of ago, v. Ritschl. Opusc. 2, 427]. </sense><sense id="n25378.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25378.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To quarrel, brawl, dispute, scold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cedo, quid jurgabit tecum?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Andr. 2, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Davo egomet vidi jurgantem ancillam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurgare igitur lex putat inter se vicinos, non litigare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:8:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 4, 8, 4</bibl></cit> (ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 430</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">ne jurgares quod,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25378.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To sue at law</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud aediles adversus lenones jurgare (al. jurgari),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:5:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 21, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: in proprio foro, Cod. Th. 2, 1, 6; 11, 33, 1.—</sense><sense id="n25378.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to chide, censure, blame</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec jurgans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:35" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">istis Jurgatur verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 100</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jurgor: <entryFree id="n25379" type="main" key="jurgor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jurgor</orth>, v. jurgo.</entryFree>
juridicatus: <entryFree id="n25380" type="gloss" key="ju_ri^di^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūrĭdĭcātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>juridicus</etym>, <sense id="n25380.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a judgeship, jurisdiction</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3117</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
juridicialis: <entryFree id="n25381" type="main" key="ju_ri^di^ci^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūrĭdĭcĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25381.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">relating to right</hi> or <hi rend="ital">justice</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">juridicialis constitutio est, cum factum convenit, sed jure, an injuria factum sit, quaeritur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 14, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:23:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 23, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 22, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:24:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 24, 92</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
juridicina: <entryFree id="n25382" type="main" key="ju_ri^di^ci_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūrĭdĭcīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25382.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the administration of justice, the office of a prætor</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
juridicus: <entryFree id="n25383" type="main" key="ju_ri^di^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūrĭdĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. jus-, 2. dico</etym>, <sense id="n25383.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">relating to the administration of justice, judiciary</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">conventus,</quote> <trans><tr>assize towns</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 7</bibl></cit>: dies, Cod. Th. 3, 12, 7.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">jūrĭdĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one who administers<cb n="JURO" />  justice, a judge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1</bibl>, tit. 20; 45, 5, 41, § 5.</sense></entryFree>
jurigo: <entryFree id="n25384" type="main" key="juri^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jurĭgo</orth>, v. jurgo <sense id="n25384.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
jurisconsultus: <entryFree id="n25385" type="main" key="ju_risconsultus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūris-consultus</orth>, or less freq. <orth extent="full" lang="la">jūre-consultus</orth> (also juris consultus and consultus juris), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>2. jus-consulo</etym>, <sense id="n25385.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one skilled in the law, a lawyer</hi> (class.).—Form jurisconsultus: <cit><quote lang="la">si quaereretur, quisnam jurisconsultus vere nominaretur, eum dicerem, qui legum et consuetudinis ejus, qua privati in civitate uterentur, et ad respondendum et ad agendum et ad cavendum peritus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:48:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 48, 212</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:19:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 19, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 11, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 34</bibl>.—Form jureconsultus: <cit><quote lang="la">ea jureconsultorum ingeniis corrupta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 12, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:18:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 18, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Mort. Pers. 22, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jurisdictio: <entryFree id="n25386" type="main" key="ju_risdicti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūris-dictĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype> (in tmesi: <sense id="n25386.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">jurisque dictio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 9</bibl></cit>;
