and separately: juris dictio), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. jus-dictio</etym>, <hi rend="ital">administration of justice, jurisdiction</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25386.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurisdictionem confeceram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: absolvere, Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 12, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25386.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25386.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Legal authority, jurisdiction, power</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sub vestrum jus, jurisdictionem, potestatem urbes subjungeretis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:6" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25386.4" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">authority, control</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae ruant urbes, quae oriantur, jurisdictio mea est,</quote> <trans><tr>it is mine to determine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">a place where justice was administered, an assize town</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">mediterraneae jurisdictiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 28, 29, § 105</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jurisonus: <entryFree id="n25387" type="main" key="ju_ri^so^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūrĭsŏnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. jus-sono</etym>, <sense id="n25387.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">resounding with justice, pronouncing judgment</hi> (al. jura sonans, leges crepans; <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): lingua, Poëta in <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 1, p. 515</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jurisperitus: <entryFree id="n25388" type="main" key="ju_rispe^ri_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūris-pĕrītus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">jūrĕ-pĕrītus</orth> (freq. also separately), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. jus-peritus</etym>, <sense id="n25388.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">skilled</hi> or <hi rend="ital">learned in the law</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Fabius Pictor et juris et litterarum et antiquitatis bene peritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:21:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 21, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:128" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 128</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quis jure peritior?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:38:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 38, 108</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentium jurisperitissimus Crassus, jurisperitorum eloquentissimus Scaevola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:39:145" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 39, 145</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jurisprudentia: <entryFree id="n25389" type="main" key="ju_rispru_denti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūris-prūdentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (also separately and <orth extent="full" lang="la">prūdentĭa jūris</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:60:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 60, 256</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cim. 2, 1</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. jus-prudentia</etym>, <sense id="n25389.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the science of law, jurisprudence</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">jurisprudentia cst divinarum humanarumque rerum notitia, justi atque injusti scientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:1:10:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 1, 10, § 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
juro: <entryFree id="n25390" type="main" key="ju_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n25390.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">jūror</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>2. jus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to swear, to take an oath</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25390.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui si aram tenens juraret, crederet nemo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 36, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ille mihi nihil, nisi ut jurarem, permitteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum enim faciles sint nonnulli hominum ad jurandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:7:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">posteaquam juratum est, denegatur actio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:2:9" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 12, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex animi tui sententia jurāris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:29:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 29, 108</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:3:51" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 3, 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Get. 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:2:13:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 12, 2, 13, § 5</bibl>.—With <case>nom.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:4:40" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 4, 40</bibl>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurat, se eum non deserturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se non reversurum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurarem ... me et ardere studio veri reperiendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 20, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi victores se redituros jurant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Boeotum in crasso jurares aëre natum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 244</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsum,</quote> <trans><tr>to swear falsely</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:29:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 29, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vere,</quote> <trans><tr>to swear truly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurarem per Jovem,</quote> <trans><tr>by Jupiter</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 20, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per supremi regis regnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 211</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:300" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 300</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per solis radios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:78" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:16" default="NO">6, 16</bibl>.—Also with simple <case>acc.</case> of the being or object sworn by (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Terram, Mare, Sidera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 197</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 324</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quomodo tibi placebit Jovem lapidem jurare, cum scias?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaevis tibi numina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 319</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Samothracum aras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:144" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 144</bibl></cit>.—Hence also <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dis juranda palus,</quote> <trans><tr>the Styx, by which the gods swear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 46</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Stygias juravimus undas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Junonis numina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:13:15" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 13, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:106" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 106</bibl></cit>.— Rarely with <case>acc.</case> of the fact sworn to: <cit><quote lang="la">morbum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to swear to the fact of sickness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jurata pacta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:274" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex mei animi sententia,</quote> <trans><tr>with sincerity, without reservation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:53:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 53, 10</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ex nostri animi sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 15, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:20:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 20, 3</bibl>: alicui aliquid,<pb n="1019" /> <cb n="JUS" />  <hi rend="ital">to vow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">promise to one</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:396" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 396</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacramenta deis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:448" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 448</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui jurare,</quote> <trans><tr>to swear allegiance to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:68:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 68, 4</bibl></cit>: in verba, <hi rend="ital">to swear with certain words</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to take a prescribed form of oath</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Petreius in haec verba jurat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur in certa verba jurent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:45:132" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 45, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites in verba P. Scipionis jurarunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in haec verba jures postulo,</quote> <trans><tr>in this form of words</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:53:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 53, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in verba magistri,</quote> <trans><tr>to echo his sentiments</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in verba ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in verba Vitellii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 8</bibl></cit>: idem deinceps omnis exercitus in se quisque jurat, i. e. each soldier took the oath separately; <cit><quote lang="la">whereas the usual practice was that one man uttered the entire oath, and the others only added, idem in me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:45:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 45, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in litem,</quote> <trans><tr>to make oath respecting the matter in dispute, to appraise under oath</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:3:18" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:5:7 al" default="NO">8, 5, 7 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nomen alicujus,</quote> <trans><tr>to swear allegiance to one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in legem,</quote> <trans><tr>to swear to observe a law</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:16:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 16, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verissimum pulcherrimumque jusjurandum,</quote> <trans><tr>to take an oath</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacramenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:447" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 447</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sceleri jurato nefando sacramenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 228</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">de</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">de sua persona,</quote> <trans><tr>in one's own behalf</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:5:1:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 44, 5, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de calumnia,</quote> <trans><tr>to clear one's self of calumny under oath</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:2:16" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 12, 2, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:8:8:section=5" default="NO">2, 8, 8, § 5</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scis, tibi ubique jurari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:68" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 68</bibl></cit>: ne in acta sua juraretur, Suet <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:26" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25390.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Dep. form, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 2, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 5, 3, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">judici demonstrandum est, quid juratus sit, quid sequi debeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:43:126" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 43, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex lege, in quam jurati sitis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 45, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juratus se eum sua manu interempturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 22, 7</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25390.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to conspire</hi> (cf. conjuro); with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: jurarunt inter se barbaros necare, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 7, § 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in me jurarunt somnus, ventusque, fidesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 242</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">jūrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n25390.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> </sense><sense id="n25390.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Called upon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">taken to witness in an oath</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25390.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Under an oath, bound by an oath</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Regulus juratus missus est ad senatum, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:26:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 26, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis jurato metuam tibi credere testi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:5" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25390.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act., having sworn, that has sworn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam injurato scio plus credet mihi quam jurato tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:281" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 281</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 1, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec, quae juratus in maxima contione dixi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eadem arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 50</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: juratissimi auctores, <hi rend="ital">the most trustworthy</hi>, Plin. H. N. praef. § 22. —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">jūrātō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with an oath, under oath</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">promittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:8:16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 8, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
juror: <entryFree id="n25391" type="main" key="ju_ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūror</orth>, <itype>ātus sum</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, v juro, I. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>.</entryFree>
jurulentia: <entryFree id="n25392" type="main" key="ju_ru^lenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūrŭlentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>jurulentus</etym>, <sense id="n25392.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">juice, the fluids in flesh</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Jejun. 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Apol. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
jurulentus: <entryFree id="n25393" type="main" key="ju_ru^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūrŭlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. jus</etym>, <sense id="n25393.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing the juice, not dried</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">res eadem magis alit jurulenta, quam assa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
jus: <entryFree id="n25394" type="main" key="ju_s1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūs</orth>, <itype>jūris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>kindred to Sanscr. yūsh, the same; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">zwmo/s</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n25394.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">broth, soup, sauce</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum una multa jura confundit cocus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo pacto ex jure hesterno panem atrum vorent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in jus vocat pisces cocus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negavit, se jure illo nigro delectatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:34:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 34, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ea cena cocus meus praeter jus fervens nihil potuit imitari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tepidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male conditum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8, 69</bibl></cit>.—In a sarcastic lusus verbb.: Verrinum, <hi rend="ital">hog-broth</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">the justice of Verres</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:46:section=121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 46, § 121</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25394.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">juice, mixture</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">addita creta in jus idem,</quote> <trans><tr>the juice of the purple-fish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 26, § 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25395" type="main" key="ju_s2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūs</orth>, <itype>jūris</itype> (<sense id="n25395.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> jurum for jurium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 86</bibl>; Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 72</bibl> and 109 P.: <cit><quote lang="la">juribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:5:3:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 5, 3, § 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 19</bibl>: jure, arch. <case>dat.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:28:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 28, 6</bibl>; Corp. Ins. Lat. 198, 31), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>kindred with Sanscr. yu, to join; cf. <foreign lang="greek">zeu/gnumi</foreign>, jungo, qs. the binding, obliging; cf. lex from ligo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">right, law, justice</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25395.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.; in <number>plur.</number> very rare, except in <case>nom.</case> and <case>acc.</case>), <hi rend="ital">that which is binding</hi> or <hi rend="ital">obligatory;</hi> that which is binding by its nature, <hi rend="ital">right, justice, duty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris praecepta sunt haec, honeste vivere, alterum non laedere, suum cuique tribuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:1:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: jus naturale est quod natura<cb n="JUSC" />  omnia animalia docuit...videmus etenim cetera quoque animalia istius juris perita censeri, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:1:1:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 1, 1, § 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 2</bibl> prooem.: omnes boni ipsam aequitatem et jus ipsum amant; <cit><quote lang="la">per se jus est appetendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:18:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 18, 48</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Gy.</hi> Amabo, hicine istuc decet? <hi rend="ital">Le.</hi> Jusque fasque est, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus hic orat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 123</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium legum atque jurium fictor, conditor cluet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus hominum situm est in generis humani societate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:26:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 26, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtinere,</quote> <trans><tr>to maintain</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de jure alicui respondere,</quote> <trans><tr>to lay down the law</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:33:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 33, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">respondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:4:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: dicere, <hi rend="ital">to pronounce judgment, give a judicial decision</hi>, as, e. g. the prætor: <cit><quote lang="la">a Volcatio, qui Romae jus dicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 246</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jura dare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 507</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetor quoque jus reddere dicitur, etiam cum inique decernit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:1:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: quid dubitas dare mihi argentum? <hi rend="ital">S.</hi> Jus petis, fateor, <hi rend="ital">you ask what is right, reasonable</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 2, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus publicum,</quote> <trans><tr>common right</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jura communia,</quote> <trans><tr>equal rights</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divina ac humana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentium,</quote> <trans><tr>the law of nations</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod naturalis ratio inter omnes homines constituit, id apud omnes populos peraeque custoditur, vocaturque jus gentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civile,</quote> <trans><tr>the civil law</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:42:section=109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 42, § 109</bibl></cit>: quod quisque populus ipse sibi jus constituit, id ipsius proprium est vocaturque jus civile, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontificium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:13:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 13, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praediatorium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:chapter=20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjugialia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 536</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus est, apponi pernam frigidam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus fasque est,</quote> <trans><tr>human and divine right</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris nodos solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:50" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 50</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">jūrĕ</orth>, adverb., <hi rend="ital">with justice, justly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jure in eum animadverteretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:8:section=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 8, § 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jure ac merito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 67</bibl></cit>, § 172; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:34" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et jure fortasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:Tusc. 3:12:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 12, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et fortasse suo jure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:Fin. 5:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te ipse, jure optimo, merito incuses licet,</quote> <trans><tr>with perfect justice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimo jure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31:111" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 31, 111</bibl></cit>; cf.: pleno jure, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 1, 5, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">justo jure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">opp. to injuria: non quaero, jure an injuria sint inimici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:61:section=150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 61, § 150</bibl></cit>: summum jus, <hi rend="ital">the extremity</hi> or <hi rend="ital">utmost rigor of the law</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non agam summo jure tecum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 2</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">4: ex quo illud, Summum jus, summa injuria, factum est jam tritum sermone proverbium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:10:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 10, 33</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so opp. (aequum et bonum habere quod defendant), si contra verbis et litteris, et, ut dici solet, summo jure contenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:23:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 23, 65</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n25395.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25395.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A place where justice is administered, a court of justice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in jus ambula,</quote> <trans><tr>come before a magistrate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 6, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in jus ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ad praetorem in jus adissemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:65:section=147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 65, § 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in jus acres procurrunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in jus vocare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:76:section=187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 76, § 187</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in jus rapere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9, 77</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 3, 72: trahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:87" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 87</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25395.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Justice, justness</hi> of a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">absolverunt, admiratione magis virtutis, quam jure causae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25395.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Legal right, power, authority, permission</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum plebe agendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:12:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 12, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiae caedendae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 55</bibl></cit>.—Of particular <hi rend="ital">rights</hi>: jus eundi, <hi rend="ital">a right of way</hi>, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 2, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus agendi, aquamve ducendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altius tollendi vel prospiciendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: jus civitatis, <hi rend="ital">the right to obtain the privileges of citizenship</hi> (cf. civitas; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Krebs, Antibarb. p. 640),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 5, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:34:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 34, 98</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">35, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:11:section=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 11,§ 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus capiendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:56" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:16:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 16, 51</bibl></cit>; cf. 6, 217: jus trium liberorum, Sen. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 16, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrium,</quote> <trans><tr>the power of life and death over their children</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines recipere in jus dicionemque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub jus judiciumque regis venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(homo) sui juris,</quote> <trans><tr>his own master, independent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:7:section=18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 7, § 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus ad mulieres,</quote> <trans><tr>over the women</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eodem jure essent, quo fuissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:6:section=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 6, § 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">melius, quod nil animis in corpora juris natura indulget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:139" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 139</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">The legal forms</hi> of the old jurists: <cit><quote lang="la">jus Flavianum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2, § 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
juscellarius: <entryFree id="n25396" type="gloss" key="juscella_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">juscellārĭus</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">zwmeth/s</foreign>, Gloss. Philox. <cb n="JUST" /></entryFree>
juscellum: <entryFree id="n25397" type="main" key="juscellum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">juscellum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>jusculum</etym>, <sense id="n25397.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">broth, soup</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 2, 13</bibl>; <number>plur.</number>, Ven. Carm. 6, 10, 18; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:23" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
juscularius: <entryFree id="n25398" type="gloss" key="juscu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">juscŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25398.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a soupmaker</hi>, Inscr. ap. Mur. 305.</sense></entryFree>
jusculum: <entryFree id="n25399" type="main" key="juscu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">juscŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>1. jus</etym>, <sense id="n25399.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a broth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigidum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jusjurandum: <entryFree id="n25400" type="main" key="jusju_randum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jus-jūrandum</orth>, <itype>jurisjurandi</itype> (often separately jurisque jurandi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:22:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 22, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:29:104" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 29, 104</bibl>; <sense id="n25400.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">in an inverted order: qui jurando jure malo quaerunt rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 63</bibl></cit>), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>2. jus-juro</etym>, <hi rend="ital">an oath</hi> (class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">sacramentum): jusjurandum pollicitus est dare mihi, neque se hasce aedes vendidisse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est enim jusjurandum affirmatio religiosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:29:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 29, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">socius vestrae religionis jurisque jurandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idem jusjurandum adigit Afranium,</quote> <trans><tr>made him take the same oath</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipere,</quote> <trans><tr>to take an oath, be sworn</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deferre alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to tender to one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:6:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">offerre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:6:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exigere ab aliquo,</quote> <trans><tr>to demand, require</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurejurando stare,</quote> <trans><tr>to keep one's oath</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:6:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conservare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:27:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 27, 100</bibl></cit>: violare, <hi rend="ital">to break</hi> or <hi rend="ital">violate</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 29</bibl>: remittere, <hi rend="ital">to dispense with</hi>, i. e. to accept the word or promise instead of the oath, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:2:6 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 12, 2, 6 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neglegere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:29:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 29, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurejurando civitatem obstringere,</quote> <trans><tr>to bind by an oath</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 76, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 18, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurejurando teneri,</quote> <trans><tr>to be bound by an oath</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:27:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 27, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurejurando aliquid decidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:1:56" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42, 1, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraudem jure tueri jurando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:201 sq" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 201 sq.</bibl></cit> —<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: jura, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:132:29" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> 132, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jusquiamus: <entryFree id="n25401" type="main" key="jusqui^a^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jusquĭămus</orth> <itype>for hyoscyamus</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 35, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> de Re Vet. 2, 12</bibl>.</entryFree>
jussio: <entryFree id="n25402" type="main" key="jussi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jussĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>jubeo</etym>, <sense id="n25402.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an order, command</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:4:44" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 4, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 15, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:27:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 27, 5 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
jussitur: <entryFree id="n25403" type="main" key="jussi^tur"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jussĭtur</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">jusso</orth>, v. jubeo.</entryFree>
jussor: <entryFree id="n25404" type="gloss" key="jussor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jussor</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">keleuth/s</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
jussorius: <entryFree id="n25405" type="main" key="jusso_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jussōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n25405.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., giving orders</hi> (late Lat.), Ps.-<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:ad Frat. Erem. Sem. 56" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> ad Frat. Erem. Sem. 56</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jussulentus: <entryFree id="n25406" type="main" key="jussu^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jussŭlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. jus</etym>, <sense id="n25406.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having broth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sauce</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">piscis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 299, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jussum: <entryFree id="n25407" type="main" key="jussum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jussum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>jubeo</etym>, <sense id="n25407.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an order, command; a law</hi> (class.; mostly in <number>plur.</number>; the <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi> is supplied by jussu; <cit><quote lang="la">v. 2. jussus): deorum immortalium jussis aliquid facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:24:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 24, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interpres Divūm fert horrida jussa per auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:378" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 378</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tua haud mollia jussa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jussis carmina coepta tuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 8, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">efficere,</quote> <trans><tr>to execute</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capessere,</quote> <trans><tr>to accept, assume to execute</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 302</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facessere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 295</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flectere,</quote> <trans><tr>to divert, annul</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">festinare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus detrectare,</quote> <trans><tr>to reject, disobey</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exuere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spernere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abnuere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 396</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peragere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">explere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:50:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 50, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">complere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,006:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Jos. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perficere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Judic. 9, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injusta jussa populis describere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:5:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jussa ac scita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:18:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 18, 42</bibl></cit>. —In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">putasne, si populus jusserit, id jussum ratum atque firmum futurum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:33:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 33, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fac jussum regis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 2, 18</bibl></cit> al.—</sense><sense id="n25407.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a physician's prescription</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jussa medicorum ministrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 133</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25407.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A father's consent</hi> to the marriage of his son: <cit><quote lang="la">jussum parentis praecedere debet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 10</bibl></cit> pr.</sense></entryFree>
jussus: <entryFree id="n25408" type="main" key="jussus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jussus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from jubeo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25409" type="main" key="jussus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jussus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (used only in <sense id="n25409.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>jubeo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">an order, command, decree</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tuo jussu profectus sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovis jussu venio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. prol. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestro jussu coactus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut ab regibus lecti aut post reges exactos jussu populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine populi jussu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 29, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romano jussu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:2:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Timotheus populi jussu bellum gessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,013:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timoth. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Neronis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:15" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patris dominive negotium gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:70" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 70</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
justa: <entryFree id="n25410" type="main" key="justa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">justa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. justus, B. 2.</entryFree>
juste: <entryFree id="n25411" type="main" key="juste_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">justē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. justus <sense id="n25411.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
justificatio: <entryFree id="n25412" type="main" key="justi^fi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">justĭfĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>justifico</etym>, <sense id="n25412.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">justification</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> Avar. 3, 2</bibl>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 16, 36.—</sense><sense id="n25412.1" n="II" level="1"> (As if from justa-facio.)<pb n="1020" /> <cb n="JUST" />  <hi rend="ital">Due formality</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">erit haec filiis Israel justificatio judiciorum, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 16, 1, 10: juxta omnes caerimonias et justificationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 9, 3</bibl></cit> and 14; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:19:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Par. 19, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heb. 9, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
justificator: <entryFree id="n25413" type="main" key="justi^fi^ca_to^r"><orth extent="full" lang="la">justĭfĭcātŏr</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>justifico</etym>, <sense id="n25413.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who justifies</hi> (eccl. Lat.), August. de Spir. et <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> 26; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
justificatrix: <entryFree id="n25414" type="main" key="justi^fi^ca_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">justĭfĭcātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>justificator</etym>, <sense id="n25414.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who justifies</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
justificatus: <entryFree id="n25415" type="main" key="justi^fi^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">justĭfĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. justifico <sense id="n25415.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
justifico: <entryFree id="n25416" type="main" key="justi^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">justĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>justificus</etym>. <sense id="n25416.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To act justly towards, do justice to</hi> one; with simple <hi rend="ital">acc. of the pers.</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">justificate viduam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25416.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To justify, make just, forgive, pardon, vindicate</hi> (post - class.): malos, Coripp. Laud. Justini jun. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">impium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Enar. in Psa. 110:3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Enar. in Psa. 110, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 8, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ex fide justificemur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,009:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Gal. 3, 24</bibl></cit> et saep.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">justĭfĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., justified</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">baptismate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 881</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 36</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Publicanus Pharisaeo justificatior discessit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Or. 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
justificus: <entryFree id="n25417" type="main" key="justi^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">justĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>justus-facio</etym>, <sense id="n25417.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that acts justly</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">mens deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 407</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
justina: <entryFree id="n25418" type="main" key="Justi_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Justīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n25418.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman empress, wife of the elder Valentinian, and mother of the younger Valentinian</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 9:7:15" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 9, 7, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
justinianus: <entryFree id="n25419" type="main" key="Justi_ni^a_nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Justīnĭānus</orth>, v. Justinus.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25420" type="main" key="Justi_ni^a_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Justīnĭānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25420.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Justinian, a Roman emperor in the sixth century of the Christian era, who caused the compilation of the</hi> Corpus Juris, Cod. Just. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Justīnĭānēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Justinian</hi>: urbs, Just. Novell. praef. 28.</sense></entryFree>
justinus: <entryFree id="n25421" type="main" key="Justi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Justīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25421.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Justin</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25421.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman historian in the second century of the Christian era, who made an abstract of the historical work of</hi> Trogus Pompeius.—</sense><sense id="n25421.2" n="II" level="1"> Justinus I., <hi rend="ital">a Roman emperor of low birth</hi> (a swine-herd) <hi rend="ital">in the sixth century of the Christian era.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n25421.3" n="III" level="1"> Justinus II., <hi rend="ital">a Roman emperor in the latter half of the sixth century</hi>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Justīnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the emperor Justin</hi>: labores, Coripp. Laud. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:263" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 263</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25421.4" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A philosopher who defended the Christians under Antoninus Pius, called also</hi> Justin Martyr, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 70, 4 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
justitia: <entryFree id="n25422" type="main" key="justi^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">justĭtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>justus</etym>, <sense id="n25422.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">justice, equity, righteousness, uprightness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae animi affectio suum cuique tribuens, atque hanc quam dico, societatem conjunctionis humanae munifice et aeque tuens, justitia dicitur, cui sunt adjunctae pietas, bonitas, liberalitas, benignitas, comitas, quaeque sunt generis ejusdem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:23:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 23, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitia est constans et perpetua voluntas jus suum cuique tribuendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitia erga deos religio, erga parentes pietas, creditis in rebus fides ... nominatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:22:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 22, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordinata erat in duodecim tabulis tota justitia,</quote> <trans><tr>the whole of the laws</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:24" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 24</bibl></cit>.—Personified: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Justĭtĭa</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the goddess of justice</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:4:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 4, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25422.1" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">righteousness, holiness, conduct in accordance with the divine law</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 15, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:9:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rom. 9, 31</bibl> et saep.— </sense><sense id="n25422.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Clemency, compassion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 32</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:chapter=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Marcell. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut meae stultitiae justitia tua sit aliquid praesidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25422.3" n="III" level="1"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">plur., judgments, precepts, ordinances</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Domini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 18, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:4:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deut. 4, 5 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
justitium: <entryFree id="n25423" type="main" key="justi^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">justĭtĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>2. jus-sisto</etym>, <sense id="n25423.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cessation from business in the courts of justice, a legal vacation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:12:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 12, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitium per aliquot dies servatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitiumque in foro sua sponte coeptum prius quam indictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prope justitium omnium rerum futurum videbatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 26, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remittere,</quote> <trans><tr>to put an end to a suspension of legal proceedings, to cause the courts to resume their business</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 21</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n25423.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a cessation of public business, a public mourning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos mors (Germanici) adeo incendit, ut, sumpto justitio, deserentur foro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcis triste tyrannicae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 5, 80</bibl></cit>; so, in a household, <hi rend="ital">a suspension of business</hi> for mourning the dead, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 8</bibl>. <cb n="JUVE" /></sense></entryFree>
justus: <entryFree id="n25424" type="main" key="justus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">justus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. jus</etym>, <sense id="n25424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">just, upright, righteous</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25424.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">justus et bonus vir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:12:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 12, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digna esse justo homine, eoque quem virum bonum dicimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in amicitia parum justus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:20:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 20, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dominus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Exod. 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in socios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:26:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 26, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui omnium justissimus fuisse traditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:67:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 67, 141</bibl></cit>.—Of things, <hi rend="ital">in accordance with law</hi> or <hi rend="ital">right, equitable, just</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:22:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 22, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">querela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:3:22" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">justissimos triumphos videre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:19:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 19, 44</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25424.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25424.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Lawful, rightful, true</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:35:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 35, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hymenaei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrimonium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:16" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:ib. 1:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 90</bibl></cit> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">liberi,</quote> <trans><tr>legitimate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:ib. 3:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:ib. 1:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justā matrefamilias ortus, opp. pellice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justissima causa faciendi aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25424.4" n="2" level="3"> Esp.: <cit><quote lang="la">dies justi,</quote> <trans><tr>a delay of thirty days allowed by law in paying debts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:43" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25424.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Due;</hi> esp. in the <hi rend="ital">plur. neutr. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ju-sta</orth>, <hi rend="ital">rights, privileges</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">servis justa praebere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:13:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 13, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:3:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">justa reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 8, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:26" default="NO">11, 1, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25424.6" n="2" level="3"> In partic.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">justa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">due ceremonies</hi> or <hi rend="ital">formalities</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia justa perficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 8</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">justis omnibus hospitalibus fungi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 6</bibl></cit>.—Esp. of <hi rend="ital">funeral rites, obsequies</hi> (cf. exsequiae): <cit><quote lang="la">justa facere uxori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">more regio justa magnifice facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justis funebribus confectis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paterno funeri justa solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peragere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 109, 112, § 248</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praestare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">persolvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferre avis positis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:480" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 480</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare manibus alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25424.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Proper, perfect, complete, reasonable, suitable, sufficient, right</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidulus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>full, with all its contents</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:48" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter conficere,</quote> <trans><tr>a regular day's march</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus,</quote> <trans><tr>complete, in full number</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muri altitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:119" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:4:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 12, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 90</bibl></cit>: loca, i. q. aequa, <hi rend="ital">even, level</hi> (opp. iniquus, <hi rend="ital">uneven</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25424.8" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Moderate, mild, gentle, easy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut justioribus utamur iis, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justa et clemens servitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n25424.9" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">justum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">that which is right</hi> or <hi rend="ital">just, justice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">justum ac jus colere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus justo,</quote> <trans><tr>more than is right, too much</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 24</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ulterius justo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:470" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 470</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravius justo dolere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:333" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 333</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justo longius,</quote> <trans><tr>too long</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:125" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeter justum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1241</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo est lex justorum injustorumque distinctio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25424.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">justē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">rightly, justly, equitably, duly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juste et legitime imperare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestimare aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 168</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">justius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:25:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 25, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reprehendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 86</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">justissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:82" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 82</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jusum: <entryFree id="n25425" type="main" key="ju_sum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūsum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>corrupt form of deorsum</etym>, <sense id="n25425.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">down, downwards</hi>, opp. susum (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Tract. in Ep. Joan. ad Parth. 8:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Tract. in Ep. Joan. ad Parth. 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:10:8" default="NO">10, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
juturna: <entryFree id="n25426" type="main" key="Ju_turna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jūturna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>juvo</etym>, <sense id="n25426.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fountain in Latium</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juturna fons est in Italia saluberrimus juxta Numicum flumen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 12, 139</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25426.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, also, <hi rend="ital">a nymph, sister of Turnus, the king of the Rutuli</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 146</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">154</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:585" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 585</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">606</bibl>.—Hence, ad Juturnae (sc. aedem), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juturnae lacus, in Rome,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:708" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 708</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 7, 9</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Jūturnālĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the festival of the nymph Juturna</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 12, 139</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jutus: <entryFree id="n25427" type="main" key="ju_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from juvo.</entryFree>
juvamen: <entryFree id="n25428" type="main" key="ju^va_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭvāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>juvo</etym>, <sense id="n25428.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">help, aid. assistance</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 12, 2</bibl>; Hilar. in Galat. 64; Aem. Mac. in Cap. de Betonica.</sense></entryFree>
juvamentum: <entryFree id="n25429" type="main" key="ju^va_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭvāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25429.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">help, aid, assistance</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 4, 25, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
juvenalis: <entryFree id="n25430" type="main" key="ju^ve^na_lis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭvĕnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>juvenis</etym>, <sense id="n25430.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">youthful, juvenile, suitable for young people</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post - Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:475" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 475</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 518</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:312" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 312</bibl>: mihi mens juvenali ardebat amore <cb n="JUVE" /> compellare virum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 163</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 2, 8, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludi,</quote> <trans><tr>a kind of games introduced by Nero</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 57, 11</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭvĕnālĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">youthful pursuits, games</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 15</bibl>;
