<bibl default="NO">15, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Gord. 4</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭvĕnālĭ-ter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a youthful manner, youthfully</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jecit ab obliquo nitidum juvenaliter aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:675" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 675</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:733" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 733</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:805" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 805</bibl>. —Hence, <hi rend="ital">rashly, improvidently</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:117 al" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 117 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25431" type="main" key="Ju^ve^na_lis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jŭvĕnālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25431.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Juvenal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">D. Junius Juvenalis,</quote> <trans><tr>a Roman satirist in the time of Domitian and Trajan</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:24:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 24, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:18:2 al" default="NO">12, 18, 2 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
juvenca: <entryFree id="n25432" type="main" key="ju^venca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭvenca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. 1. juvencus.</entryFree>
juvenculasco: <entryFree id="n25433" type="main" key="ju^vencu^lasco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭvencŭlasco</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <sense id="n25433.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch.</hi> [juvenculus], <hi rend="ital">to become youthful, to grow into youth</hi>: juvenculescat adulescentia, senecta canescat, Ambros. de Cain et Abel, 2, 1, 2.</sense></entryFree>
juvenculus: <entryFree id="n25434" type="main" key="ju^vencu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭvencŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n25434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [juvenca], <hi rend="ital">young</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Monog. 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viduae,</quote> <trans><tr>young widows</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: bos, Ambros. de Tob. § 25; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:67:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 67, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25434.1" n="II" level="1"> As <hi rend="ital">subst</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25434.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭvencŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a young man</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Apol. Dav. 3, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25434.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A young bullock</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:31:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 31, 18</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n25434.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭvencŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <hi rend="ital">a young girl</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:68:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 68, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 9</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Tim. 5, 2</bibl> al.</sense></entryFree>
juvencus: <entryFree id="n25435" type="main" key="ju^vencus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭvencus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (<sense id="n25435.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> juvencūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:609" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 609</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contr. from juvenicus, from juvenis</etym>, <hi rend="ital">young</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1074" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1074</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 53, 74, § 146</bibl></cit>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n25435.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25435.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭvencus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n25435.3" n="1" level="3"> Sc. bos, <hi rend="ital">a young bullock</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspice, aratra jugo referunt suspensa juvenci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">est in juvencis, est in Equis patrum virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fessi juvenci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:648" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 648</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25435.4" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf., <hi rend="ital">neat's leather</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clipeum vestisse juvenco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:591" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 591</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25435.5" n="2" level="3"> Sc. homo, <hi rend="ital">a young man</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te suis matres metuunt juvencis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 8, 21</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25435.6" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭvenca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n25435.7" n="1" level="3"> (Sc. bos.) <hi rend="ital">A young cow, heifer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pascitur in magna Sila formosa juvenca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 219</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:49" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25435.8" n="2" level="3"> Sc. femina, <hi rend="ital">a girl</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Helen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 117</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:350" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 350</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25436" type="main" key="Ju^vencus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jŭvencus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25436.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a priest in Spain in the time of Constantine the Great, who made a metrical version of the four Gospels</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 70, 5</bibl> (I. p. 430 Vall.); v. Teuffel, Röm. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> p. 912 sq.</sense></entryFree>
juvenesco: <entryFree id="n25437" type="main" key="ju^ve^nesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭvĕnesco</orth>, <itype>nŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n25437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [juvenis]. </sense><sense id="n25437.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To reach the age of youth, to grow up</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">vitulus ... largis juvenescit herbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo juvenuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Exhort. ad Cast. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n25437.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To grow young again</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25437.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pylius juvenescere posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:7:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 7, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glires aestate juvenescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 57, 82, § 224</bibl></cit>. —Of plants: <cit><quote lang="la">rosa recisa juvenescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 11, 40, § 69</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25437.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to become vigorous, regain strength, flourish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladii juvenescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:583" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 583</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus regni juvenescit,</quote> <trans><tr>recovers itself</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">continuo montes muro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> VI. Cons. Honor. 534</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
juvenilis: <entryFree id="n25438" type="main" key="ju^ve^ni_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭvĕnīlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">jŭvĕnāl-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25438.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to youth, youthful, juvenile</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25438.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: juvenilis quaedam dicendi impunitas et licentia. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:91:316" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 91, 316</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">redundantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:30:108" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 30, 108</bibl></cit>: sumptis Priamum juvenalibus armis vidit. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:518" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 518</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 475</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valida ac juvenilia membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:5" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:632" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 632</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:564" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 564</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">femur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suis semper juvenilior annis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:639" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 639</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidus juvenile nepotes,</quote> <trans><tr>shining among the youths like stars, a youthful constellation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:167" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 167</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25438.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25438.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Lively, cheerful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">integer et laetus laeta et juvenilia lusi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:1:7" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25438.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Violent, strong</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeceps juvenile pericli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:4:50" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 4, 50</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">advv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n25438.5" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭvĕnīle</orth>, <hi rend="ital">youthfully</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adhuc juvenile vagans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:5:25" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 5, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25438.6" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭvĕnīlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">youthfully, after the manner of youth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsultare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 4, 10</bibl></cit> (in Ovid only juvenaliter; v. juvenalis <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
juvenilitas: <entryFree id="n25439" type="main" key="ju^ve^ni_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭvĕnīlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>juvenilis</etym>, <sense id="n25439.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">youth, juvenility</hi> (ante-class.), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 123, 8</bibl>. <pb n="1021" /> <cb n="JUVE" /></sense></entryFree>
juveniliter: <entryFree id="n25440" type="main" key="ju^ve^ni_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭvĕnīlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. juvenilis <sense id="n25440.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
juvenis: <entryFree id="n25441" type="main" key="ju^ve^nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭvĕnis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (<sense id="n25441.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> juvenior, for the more usual junior, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 210, 36</bibl>) [Sanscr. yuvan, young]. </sense><sense id="n25441.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut juveni primum virgo deducta marito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:31" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est mihi filius juvenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenes anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 295</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenes premere Medos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:132" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ovis juvenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:7:6" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 7, 6</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">toto junior anno,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dis junioribus permisit ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25441.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭvĕnis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <hi rend="ital">comm., one who is in the flower of his</hi> or <hi rend="ital">her age</hi> (mostly of persons older than adolescentes and younger than seniores, i. e. between twenty and forty years), <hi rend="ital">a young person, a young man, a young woman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infirmitas puerorum, et ferocitas juvenum, et gravitas jam constantis aetatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul ac juvenes esse coeperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:13:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 13, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas juvenum (opp. senum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:19:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 19, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenem egregium praestanti munere donat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 361</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenes fervidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:13:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 13, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nefas si juvenis vetulo non assurrexerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:55" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telluris juvenes = terrae filios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamosus juvenem pater excitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:191" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 191</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">juvenes ipsius consulis,</quote> <trans><tr>sons</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:262" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 262</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">edicitur delectus: juniores ad nomina respondent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:41:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 41, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 2, 6</bibl>: junior (opp. senior), <hi rend="ital">the son, the younger of the name</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Enar. in Psa. 45, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos (milites) ad annum quadragesimum sextum juniores, supraque eum annum seniores appellavit (Servius Tullius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:28:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 28, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cornelia juvenis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 36, 36, § 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulchra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 63</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">amica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 2</bibl></cit>, praef. 23.—</sense><sense id="n25441.3" n="B" level="2"> Juvenis (for juventus), <hi rend="ital">the youth, the young men</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectus juvenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:219" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 219</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
juvenix: <entryFree id="n25442" type="main" key="ju^ve^nix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭvĕnix</orth>, v. junix.</entryFree>
juvenor: <entryFree id="n25443" type="hapax" key="ju^ve^nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭvĕnor</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>juvenis</etym>, <sense id="n25443.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to act with youthful indiscretion, to wanton</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut nimium teneris juvenentur versibus umquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 246</bibl></cit>; cf.: juvenor, <foreign lang="greek">newteri/zw</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
juventa: <entryFree id="n25444" type="main" key="ju^venta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭventa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the age of youth, youth</hi> (mostly post-Aug. for the class. juventus). </sense><sense id="n25444.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra decora juventā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:559" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 559</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima a parte juventae, Cic. Att. poët. 2, 3, 3: Euryalus forma insignis, viridique juventa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 295</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 719</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ita se a juventa eum gessisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua capta juventa Hippia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:103" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Livia, prima sua juventa ex Nerone gravida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 55, 76, § 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elephantorum juventa a sexagesimo anno incipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 10, 10, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitidus juventā (of the snake),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:437" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 437</bibl></cit>.—Of plants, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 23, 35, § 86</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">youth, young people</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">moderator juventae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:90:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 90, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25444.2" n="II" level="1"> Personified, <hi rend="ital">the goddess of youth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 241</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:10:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 10, 12</bibl>; cf. the foll. art.</sense></entryFree>
juventas: <entryFree id="n25445" type="main" key="ju^ventas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭventas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25445.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the age of youth, youth</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25445.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:888" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 888</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:398" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 398</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 11, 6</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the eagle,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25445.2" n="II" level="1"> Personified: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Jŭventas</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the goddess of youth, Hebe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:40:112" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 40, 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 18, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:26:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 26, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:30:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 30, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 54 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:62:9" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 62, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:36:5" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 36, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
juventius: <entryFree id="n25446" type="main" key="Ju^venti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jŭventĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Jŭvenc-</orth>), <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n25446.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens; <cit><quote lang="la">e. g. M. Juventius Pedo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 30</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Jŭventĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Juventius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">familia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 8, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
juventus: <entryFree id="n25447" type="main" key="ju^ventus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭventus</orth>, <itype>ūtis</itype> (scanned as dissyl., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 38</bibl>; cf. junior), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>juvenis</etym>, <sense id="n25447.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the age of youth</hi> (from the twentieth to the fortieth year), <hi rend="ital">youth</hi> (rare, except in transf. meaning; cf. juventas). </sense><sense id="n25447.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae juventute geruntur et viribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibique juventutem suam exercuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 5, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25447.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr. </sense><sense id="n25447.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Young persons, youth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo nemo adaeque juventute ex omni Attica antehac est habitus parcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventutis mores scire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: nulla juventutis est spes; <cit><quote lang="la">sese omnes amant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ob eamque causam juventus nostra dedisceret paene discendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:24:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 24, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnis juventus, omnes etiam gravioris aetatis eo convenerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 16, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 14</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 6, 23, 6; id. <cb n="JUXT" /> B. C. 2, 5, 3 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:8:2" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 8, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Trojana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:467" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 467</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cannis consumpta juventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:155" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alios caedit sua quemque juventus,</quote> <trans><tr>pupils</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:213" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 213</bibl></cit>.—Of young bees, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 22</bibl>; hence: princeps juventutis, in the time of the republic <hi rend="ital">the first among the knights</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 10, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 11, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">under the emperors,</quote> <trans><tr>a title of the imperial princes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25447.4" n="B" level="2"> Personified: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Jŭventus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the goddess of youth</hi> (for the usual Juventas): <cit><quote lang="la">FLAMINIS IVVENTVTIS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2213</bibl></cit>; Hyg. Fab. praef.</sense></entryFree>
juverna: <entryFree id="n25448" type="main" key="Ju_verna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jūverna</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Jūberna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n25448.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Ireland</hi>, Mela, 3, 6, 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:160" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 160</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
juvo: <entryFree id="n25449" type="main" key="ju^vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭvo</orth>, <itype>jūvi, jūtum, 1</itype> (juvaturus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 47:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 47, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:15:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 15, 13</bibl>: <sense id="n25449.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">iuerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 18</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>perh. root div-, to gleam; cf. dies</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to help, aid, assist, support, benefit</hi> (cf.: auxilior, subvenio, opitulor). </sense><sense id="n25449.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui se natos ad homines juvandos, tutandos, conservandos arbitrantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:14:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 14, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beatae vitae disciplinam juvare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:21:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 21, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem omni suo studio in petitione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem auxilio laboris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes frumento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvit facundia causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:505" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 505</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbres arva juvantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:647" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 647</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Juppiter) juvat imbribus agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:1:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem portuque locoque,</quote> <trans><tr>by receiving into harbor and house</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudum hospitio tectoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:211" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora alloquio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:6:18" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audentes deus ipse juvat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:586" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 586</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audentes Fortuna juvat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 284</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in aliqua re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 41</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">two acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid Rutulos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 84</bibl></cit>. —Of medical assistance: <cit><quote lang="la">qui salutari juvat arte fessos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:63" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:270" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 270</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 10, § 14</bibl>: dis juvantibus or deo juvante, <hi rend="ital">with God's help</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me, dis juvantibus, ante brumam exspecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 20, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:66:165" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 66, 165</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non denique quicquam aliud nisi juvantibus sacris deligunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 7, 5, § 21</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex Cornelia proscriptum juvari vetat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:47:section=123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 47, § 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viatico a me juvabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">precor, quaeras, qua sim tibi parte juvandus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:12" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placuit sollertia, tempore etiam juta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 4 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit> (al. adjuta): <cit><quote lang="la">nec sola (lingua) loquendi munus implere potest, nisi juta, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Opif. D. 10, 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>, juvat, <hi rend="ital">it is of use;</hi> with a <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvat Ismara Baccho Conserere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid docuisse juvabat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:858" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 858</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid juvat esse deum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:965" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 965</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25449.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to delight, gratify, please</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvare in utroque (in sensu et in animo) dicitur: ex eoque jucundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>. —In this sense rarely as a personal verb: nec umquam quicquam me juvat quod edo domi; <cit><quote lang="la">Foris ... quod gusto id beat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non omnis arbusta juvant humilesque myricae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec me vita juvaret, invisa civibus et militibus meis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si nec fabellae te juvant nec fabulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multos castra juvant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurem juvantia verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 159</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">refer ad aures, probabunt: quaere, cur? ita se dicent juvari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:48:159" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 48, 159</bibl></cit>.—More freq. <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi>, juvat (aliquem), with <hi rend="ital">subject-clause, it delights, pleases, I (thou, he</hi>, etc.) <hi rend="ital">am delighted, take pleasure in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvit me, tibi tuas litteras profuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvat me haec praeclara nomina artificum ... concidisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:6:section=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 6, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forsan et haec olim meminisse juvabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvat evasisse tot urbes Argolicas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 282</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insano juvat indulgere labori,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si pereo, hominum manibus periisse juvabit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 606</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae scire magis juvat quam prodest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 106" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 106</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
juxta: <entryFree id="n25450" type="main" key="juxta_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">juxtā</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> and <pos>prep.</pos> <etym><hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> form from jugis; v. jungo</etym>, <sense id="n25450.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">near to, nigh</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25450.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n25450.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of place. </sense><sense id="n25450.3" n="1" level="3"> Of several objects, <hi rend="ital">near together, in close proximity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">theatra duo juxta fecit amplissima e ligno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 117</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25450.4" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">near at hand, near, near by, hard by, close to, by the side of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legio, quae juxta constiterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sellam juxta poneret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 65:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 65, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furiarum maxima juxta Accubat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:605" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 605</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forte fuit juxta tumulus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procul vel juxta sitas vires circumspectabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 72</bibl></cit>: talem perlatum<cb n="JUXT" />  Pompeio juxta res gerenti Mithridatico bello, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 17, 19, § 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">abjecto clam juxta pugione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">thermisque juxta celeriter constructis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 7</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Rarely with verbs of motion: accedere juxta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:809" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 809</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25450.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">in like manner, equally, alike</hi> (syn.: aeque, pariter). </sense><sense id="n25450.6" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum ego vitam mortemque juxta aestimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestatem et hiemem juxta pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 85, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceteri juxta insontes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui Argenta habent, aliaque castella juxta ignobilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juxta periculosum seu ficta seu vera promeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solo caeloque juxta gravi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25450.7" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fabius omittendam rem parvam ac juxta magnis difficilem censebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 19, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25450.8" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ac, atque, et, quam, cum</hi>, in the sense of <hi rend="ital">as, than</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aeque ac, pariter ac, etc.): juxta tecum aeque scio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juxta eam curo cum mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 160</bibl></cit> (so always in Plaut.; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Brix ad loc.): juxta mecum omnes intellegitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 58:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 58, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">absentium bona juxta atque interemptorum divisa fuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:54:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 54, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:33:10" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 33, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juxta eam rem aegre passi patres, quam cum consulatum vulgari viderent,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>were just as indignant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: qui me, juxta ac si meus frater esset, sustentavit, <hi rend="ital">just as if</hi>, = non secus ac si, Cic. post Red. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:8:20" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> 8, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juxta ac si hostes adessent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 45:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 45, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 31, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in re juxta manifesta atque atroci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:33:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 33, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 33, 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">5, 6, 5: reipublicae juxta ac sibi consulere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 37:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 37, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteris Graecis atque Latinis juxta eruditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 95:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 95, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juxta bonos et malos interficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 51, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25450.9" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Prep.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">acc., very near, close to, near to, hard by</hi> (not ante-class.). </sense><sense id="n25450.10" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of place: <cit><quote lang="la">juxta eum castra posuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:41:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 41, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 65, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 20, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juxta murum castra posuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totos dies juxta focum atque ignem agunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:8:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 8, 2</bibl>.—Placed after the case: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc (aram) juxta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicina Ceraunia juxta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:506" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 506</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubiculum Caesaris juxta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhenum juxta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberim juxta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aditum juxta moenia urbis Volsco militi struxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:4:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25450.11" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25450.12" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Next to, immediately after, beside, on a par with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juxta deos in tua manu positum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud quos juxta divinas religiones, humana fides colitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo, juxta M. Varronem doctissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vilitate juxta beluas esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 7, 5, § 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25450.13" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Near, approaching to, like, almost the same as</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">velocitas juxta formidinem, cunctatio propior constantiae est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravitate annonae juxta seditionem ventum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juxta seditionem esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:67:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 67, 11</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">populi imperium juxta libertatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapor juxta fontis dulcissimos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 4, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25450.14" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Along with, together with</hi>: cum interea lucubrando faceret juxta ancillas lanam, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 322</bibl>: juxta se conjuges vexari, <hi rend="ital">just as</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pariter ac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculosiores sunt inimicitiae juxta libertatem,</quote> <trans><tr>among a free people</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25450.15" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">In consequence of, in proportion to</hi> (post-class., except one doubtful passage in Liv.): <cit><quote lang="la">huic consuetudo juxta vicinitatem cum Aebutio fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 9, 6</bibl></cit> dub. Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quem juxta nocturnum visum ergastulo liberavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:7:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivium juxta regiam magnificentiam ludis exornat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:3:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 3, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25450.16" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">According to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juxta praeceptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:12:25" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 12, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Nazar.</author> Pan. Const. 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 1, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juxta morem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 19, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juxta hoc videtur et divus Hadrianus rescripsisse in haec verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:5:1:section=28" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 5, 1, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juxta inclytum oratorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 82</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
juxtim: <entryFree id="n25451" type="main" key="juxtim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">juxtim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> and <pos>prep.</pos> <etym>juxta</etym>, <sense id="n25451.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">next to, close by</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25451.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: in sedes collocat se regias Clytaemnestra juxtim, Liv. Andron. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 127, 32</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 2 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">assidebat juxtim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25451.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">near to us, in the neighborhood</hi> quae fuerint juxtim quadrata, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:501" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 501</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25451.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">In an equal degree, equally</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed quos utriusque figurae esse vides, juxtim miscentes vulta parentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1213</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n25451.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Prep.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">acc., near, next to</hi>: juxtim Numicium flumen obtruncatur, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 127, 30</bibl>. <pb n="1022" /> <cb n="KOPP" /> <cb n="K." /></sense></entryFree>
k: <entryFree id="n25452" type="main" key="K"><orth extent="full" lang="la">K</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">k</orth>, was used in the oldest period of the language as a separate character for the sound <sense id="n25452.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">k</hi>, while <hi rend="ital">C</hi> was used for the sound <hi rend="ital">g</hi>. In course of time the character C came to be used also for the <hi rend="ital">k</hi> sound, and, after the introduction of the character G, for that alone, and K disappeared almost entirely from the Latin orthography, except at the beginning of a few words, for each of which, also, the letter K itself was in common use as an abbreviation; thus, Kæso (or Cæso), Kalendæ (less correctly Calendæ), sometimes Karthago (or Kar.; v. Carthago); <cit><quote lang="la">and in special connections, Kalumnia, Kaput (for Calumnia and Caput, e. g. k. k. = calumniae causā in jurid. lang.): nam k quidem in nullis verbis utendum puto, nisi quae significat, etiam ut sola ponatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 4, 9</bibl>.—Some grammarians, indeed, as early as Quintilian's time, thought it proper always to write K for initial C before <hi rend="ital">a</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 10</bibl>.—Besides the above-mentioned abbreviations, the K is also found in KA. for capitalis, KK. for castrorum, K. S. for carus suis.</sense></entryFree>
kalendae: <entryFree id="n25453" type="main" key="Ka^lendae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Kălendae</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Cal-</orth>; <sense id="n25453.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> the letter <ref targOrder="U">K</ref></xr>), <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root kal-, cal-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kale/w</foreign>; Lat. calāre, clamo; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=27" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 27</bibl> Müll.; prop., the day when the order of days was proclaimed; hence</etym>, <hi rend="ital">the Calends, the first day of the month</hi>: primi dies nominati Kalendae, ab eo quod his diebus calantur ejus mensis nonae a pontificibus, quintanae an septimanae sint futurae, Varr. L. L. l. l.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed heus tu, ecquid vides Kalendas venire, Antonium non venire?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras accepi datas pridie Kalendas Maias,</quote> <trans><tr>on the last day of April</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 20, 1</bibl></cit>.—Interest was due on the first day of each month; <cit><quote lang="la">hence: tristes Kalendae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 561</bibl></cit>.—This reckoning of time was Roman only; <cit><quote lang="la">hence: Kalendae Ausoniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:55" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 55</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: ad Kalendas Graecas solvere, i. e. <hi rend="ital">never</hi>, August. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:87" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 87</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">The Kalends were sacred to Juno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:55" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 15</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence the first day of the year, Kalendae Martiae, was celebrated as a festival of married women, the Matronalia: dabat, sicut Saturnalibus viris apophoreta, ita per Kalendas Martias feminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Martiis caelebs quid agam Kalendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scis certe, puto, vestra jam venire Saturnalia, Martias Kalendas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:84:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 84, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:1:31:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 1, 31, § 8</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence: femineae Kalendae = Kal. Mart.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:53" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Kalendae Sextae,</quote> <trans><tr>the Calends of June</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:181" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Kalendae Germanicae,</quote> <trans><tr>the Calends of September</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4949</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in memoriam patris Septembrem mensem Germanicum appellavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 15</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">Kalendae Januariae primae,</quote> <trans><tr>of next January</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 147 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3121</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25453.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a month</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec totidem veteres, quot nunc, habuere Kalendas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:99" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra septimas Kalendas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:100:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 100, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:75:7" default="NO">10, 75, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:46" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 45, 1, 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
kalendalis: <entryFree id="n25454" type="main" key="Ka^lenda_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Kălendālis</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Kălendāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Kalendae</etym>, <sense id="n25454.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Kalends; of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the first day of the month</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tributa Kalendalia,</quote> <trans><tr>which fall due on the Kalends</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Edict. 13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Edict. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juno Kalendaris,</quote> <trans><tr>to whom worship is paid on the Kalends</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 15, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
kalendarium: <entryFree id="n25455" type="main" key="Ka^lenda_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Kălendārĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Cal-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a debt-book, account-book, the interest-book of a money-lender</hi>, because monthly interest was reckoned to the Kalends: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo beneficia in Kalendario scribit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:2:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 14:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 14, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid fenus et Kalendarium et usura, nisi humanae cupiditatis extra naturam quaesita nomina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:10:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 7, 10, 3</bibl></cit>; Orig. 12, 1, 41; 15, 1, 58 al.; <cit><quote lang="la">also called Kalendarii liber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87, 7</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n25455.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">graciles aurium cutes Kalendarium expendunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a fortune, a whole estate</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Hab. Mul. 1, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
kalendarius: <entryFree id="n25456" type="main" key="Ka^lenda_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Kălendārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25456.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Kalends</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">strena,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Ephes. 3, 6, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
kalo: <entryFree id="n25457" type="main" key="Kalo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Kalo</orth>, v. calo.</entryFree>
karthago: <entryFree id="n25458" type="main" key="Kartha_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Karthāgo</orth>, v. Carthago.</entryFree>
koppa: <entryFree id="n25459" type="greek" key="Koppa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Koppa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Coppa</orth>), <gen>n.</gen> <itype>indecl.</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">ko/ppa</foreign>, <cb n="LABD" /> <sense id="n25459.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a letter of the original Greek alphabet</hi>, in which it stood between <foreign lang="greek">p</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">r</foreign>, and corresponded to the Hebr. <hi rend="ital">koph</hi> and the Lat. <hi rend="ital">q.</hi> It was rejected in the literary language, <foreign lang="greek">k</foreign> taking its place, but was retained as a numeral, = 90, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:10" default="NO">1, 7, 10</bibl>. <cb n="L." /></sense></entryFree>
l: <entryFree id="n25460" type="main" key="L"><orth extent="full" lang="la">L</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">l</orth>, <itype>indecl.</itype> <gen>n.</gen> or (on account of littera) <gen>f.</gen>, the eleventh letter of the Latin alphabet (I and J being counted as one), in form modified from a <foreign lang="greek">*l</foreign>, like the Greek, but with the angle downward. In sound it was identical with Gr. lambda, Engl. <sense id="n25460.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">l.</hi> L has, according to Pliny, a threefold power: the slight sound of the second <hi rend="ital">l</hi>, when doubled, as in <hi rend="ital">ille, Metellus;</hi> a full sound, when it ends words or syllables, or follows a consonant in the same syllable, as in <hi rend="ital">sol, silva, flavus, clarus;</hi> and a middle sound in other cases, as in <hi rend="ital">lectus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1, 7, 38</bibl> (p. 555 P.). In transcriptions of Greek words in Latin and of Latin words in Greek letters, it always corresponds to <foreign lang="greek">*l</foreign>.</sense><sense id="n25460.1" n="II" level="1"> In etymology it represents, </sense><sense id="n25460.2" n="1" level="3"> Usually an original <hi rend="ital">l;</hi> cf. alius, <foreign lang="greek">a)/llos</foreign>; lego, <foreign lang="greek">le/gw</foreign>; leo, <foreign lang="greek">le/wn</foreign>; lavo, <foreign lang="greek">lou/w</foreign>, etc.—</sense><sense id="n25460.3" n="2" level="3"> Sometimes an <hi rend="ital">r</hi>, as in lilium, <foreign lang="greek">lei/rion</foreign>; balbus, <foreign lang="greek">ba/rbaros</foreign>; latrare, Sanscr. ra-, to bark; lateo, Sanscr. rah-, to abandon; luceo, Sanscr. ruc-, etc.; cf. also the endings in australis, corporalis, liberalis, and in stellaris, capillaris, maxillaris.—</sense><sense id="n25460.4" n="3" level="3"> Sometimes a <hi rend="ital">d;</hi> cf. lacrima, <foreign lang="greek">da/kruon</foreign>; levir, Sanscr. dēvar, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">dah/r</foreign>; oleo, odor, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o)/zw, o)/dwda</foreign>; uligo, udus; adeps, Sanscr lip-, to smear, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)/leifar</foreign>.</sense><sense id="n25460.5" n="III" level="1"> Before <hi rend="ital">l</hi> an initial guttural or <hi rend="ital">t</hi> is often dropped, as latus for tlatus, lis for stlis, lamentum from clamo; lac, cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">galakt</foreign>-; and a preceding <hi rend="ital">c, d, n, r, s</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">x</hi> is omitted or assimilated, as sella for sedula (sed-la), corolla for coronula (coronla), prelum for prem-lum (from premo), āla = ax-la (axilla); so, libellus for liberulus (liber), alligo for ad-ligo, ullus for unulus. In the nominative of nouns the ending <hi rend="ital">s</hi> is not added after <hi rend="ital">l</hi>, as in consul, vigil; and <hi rend="ital">l</hi> final occurs in Latin only in such words.</sense><sense id="n25460.6" n="IV" level="1"> L stands alone, </sense><sense id="n25460.7" n="A" level="2"> As a numeral for 50.—</sense><sense id="n25460.8" n="B" level="2"> As an abbreviation, usually for Lucius; rarely for libens, locus, or libertus.</sense></entryFree>
labarum: <entryFree id="n25461" type="greek" key="la^ba^rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăbărum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">labaro/n</foreign>, <sense id="n25461.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the labarum, a Roman military standard of the later times, richly ornamented with gold and precious stones, and bearing the effigy of the general. Constantine the Great placed upon it a crown, a cross, and the initial letters of the name</hi> Jesus Christus, <hi rend="ital">and made it the imperial standard</hi>, Prud. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:487" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> 1, 487</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
labasco: <entryFree id="n25462" type="main" key="la^basco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăbasco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n25462.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n. inch.</hi>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">lăba-scor</orth>, <itype>ci</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>labo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to totter, be ready to fall</hi> (ante-and post-class.). </sense><sense id="n25462.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod crebro tunditur ictu, vincitur in longo spatio tamen atque labascit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1285</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:537" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 537</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25462.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to waver, give way, yield</hi>. —Form labascor, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 473, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam vidit misericordia labasci mentem infirmam populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 473:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> ib. 473, 11</bibl></cit>.—Form labasco: <cit><quote lang="la">leno labascit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labascit victus uno verbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 98</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum vi quadam nova ictum labascere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:2:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
labda: <entryFree id="n25463" type="main" key="labda1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">labda</orth>, <gen>n.</gen> <itype>indecl.</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">la/mbda</foreign>, <sense id="n25463.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Greek letter</hi> <foreign lang="greek">*l</foreign>; <hi rend="ital">supinum</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">an inverted</hi> V, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 943</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25463.1" type="greek" key="labda2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">labda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">la/bda</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a voluptuary</hi>, i. q. irrumator (ante- and post-class.), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 70, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 126</bibl>.</entryFree>
labdace: <entryFree id="n25464" type="main" key="Labda^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Labdăcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*labda/kh</foreign>, <sense id="n25464.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a girl</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 79, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
labdacides: <entryFree id="n25465" type="main" key="Labda^ci^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Labdăcĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Labdacus, II. B.</entryFree>
labdacismus: <entryFree id="n25466" type="greek" key="labda^cismus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">labdăcismus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">labdakismo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n25466.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">labdacism</hi>, a fault in speaking. </sense><sense id="n25466.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The too frequent use of the letter l</hi> (as, sol et luna luce lucebant alba, levi, lactea), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 514</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25466.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An erroneous pronunciation of the letter l</hi>, like the Spanish ll, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> 448</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 1, 31, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
labdacus: <entryFree id="n25467" type="main" key="Labda^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Labdăcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*la/bdakos</foreign>, <sense id="n25467.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Thebes, father of Lāius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc Fur. 495" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc Fur. 495</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phoen. 53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Phoen. 53</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25467.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n25467.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lab-dăcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to</hi> <cb n="LABE" /> <hi rend="ital">Labdacus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dux,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Eteocles, so called after his grandfather Lāius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:210" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 210</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25467.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Labdăcĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a male descendant of Labdacus, a Labdacide;</hi> applied to <hi rend="ital">Polynīces</hi> as grandson of Laius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:450" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 450</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Labdăcĭdae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Thebans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:777" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 777</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
labea: <entryFree id="n25468" type="main" key="la^be^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăbĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. labia.</entryFree>
labeates: <entryFree id="n25469" type="main" key="Labe^a_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Labĕātes</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Labĕātae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 22, 26, § 144</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25469.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Illyria, whose capital was</hi> Scodra, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32" default="NO" valid="yes">32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:26" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 26</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Labĕātis</orth>, <itype>īdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Labeates</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 31, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Meteone Labeatidis terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 23, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
labecula: <entryFree id="n25470" type="main" key="la_be_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lābēcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>2. labes</etym>, <sense id="n25470.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slight stain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disgrace, a blemish; opprobrium</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui aspergere labeculam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:17:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 17, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
labefacio: <entryFree id="n25471" type="main" key="la^be^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăbĕfăcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, factum</itype> (labefactarier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 3, 5</bibl>), 3, <sense id="n25471.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a.; pass.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lăbĕfīo</orth>, <itype>factus, fieri</itype> <etym>labo-facio</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to cause to totter, to shake, loosen, to make ready to fall</hi> (Cic. uses only labefactus). </sense><sense id="n25471.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partem muri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labefactae aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labefacta ictibus arbor Corruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:776" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 776</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">charta (i. e. epistola) a vinclis non labefacta suis,</quote> <trans><tr>loosened, opened</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:7:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munimenta incussu arietis labefieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. Sap. 6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. Sap. 6</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes labefacti aëre multo,</quote> <trans><tr>weakened</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:653" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 653</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra voluptatis dum vi labefacta liquescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calor labefacta per ossa cucurrit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:390" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 390</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25471.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25471.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To cause to waver, to shake</hi> a person in his mind, principles, or fidelity: aliquem, Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem nulla umquam vis, nullae minae, nulla invidia labefecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:47:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 47, 101</bibl></cit>. primores classiariorum, <hi rend="ital">to shake their fidelity, excite them to mutiny</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic animus vario labefactus vulnere nutat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:375" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 375</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in Greek construction: magno animum labefactus amore,</quote> <trans><tr>shaken, disquieted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:395" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 395</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n25471.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To shake, weaken; to overthrow, ruin, destroy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec (res publica) jam labefacta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:27:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 27, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo, per contumeliam consulum, jura plebis labefacta essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil hunc amicitia Sejani, sed labefacit haud minus ad exitia Macronis odium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 29</bibl></cit> (35): <cit><quote lang="la">si priorem aetate et jam labefactum demovisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quis contagione ceteros labefaciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:5:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 93</bibl>: fidem, <hi rend="ital">to shake</hi> or <hi rend="ital">weaken one's credit</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
labefactatio: <entryFree id="n25472" type="main" key="la^be^facta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăbĕfactātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>labefacio</etym>, <sense id="n25472.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shaking, loosening, weakening</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25472.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentium,</quote> <trans><tr>looseness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 27, § 56</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n25472.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mediocris labefactatio caedi comparatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: libertatis, Cod. Th. 4, 8, 5, § 5.</sense></entryFree>
