labefacto: <entryFree id="n25473" type="main" key="la^be^facto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăbĕfacto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25473.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cause to totter, to shake, to overthrow</hi> (syn.: quatio, concutio). </sense><sense id="n25473.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum vectibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:43:section=49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 43, § 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrea bellicis machinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedium fundamenta, Cod. Th. 10, 19, 14: phalangii morsus genua labefactat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 27, § 86</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25473.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to injure, weaken, ruin, destroy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:694" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 694</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">onus gravidi ventris,</quote> <trans><tr>to procure an abortion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colla boum,</quote> <trans><tr>to hurt, gall</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:22" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25473.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to shake, throw down, overthrow, destroy, ruin, weaken</hi> (a favorite expression of Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">animam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:798" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 798</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 25, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 12, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:14:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 14, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus consulatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:13:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 13, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus dignitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:16:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 16, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiā verbi orationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:13:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 13, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aristoteles primus species labefactavit, quas mirifice Plato erat amplexatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 9, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjurationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam ad judicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; so, labefactare alone, <hi rend="ital">to shake in purpose, move, cause to yield</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me video ab ea astute labefactarier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labefacto paulatim (sc. eum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non illam rarae labefactes munere vestis,</quote> <trans><tr>corrupt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:69:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 69, 3</bibl></cit>, cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">castimoniam viduae, Cod. Th. 9, 25, 1: rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:13:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 13, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximas res publicas ab adulescentibus labefactatas ... reperietis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:6:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 6, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Carthaginem et Corinthum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:4:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: labefactarat <pb n="1023" /> <cb n="LABE" /> vehementer aratores superior annus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:18:section=47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 18, § 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiam aut justitiam labefactare atque pervertere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:21:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 21, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges ac jura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:25:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 25, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus fidem pretio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:68:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 68, 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provinciarum fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(praecepta) labefactari aliqua parte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
labefactus: <entryFree id="n25474" type="main" key="la^be^factus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăbĕfactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from labefacio.</entryFree>
labefio: <entryFree id="n25475" type="main" key="la^be^fi_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăbĕfīo</orth>, <sense id="n25475.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> of labefacio.</sense></entryFree>
labellum: <entryFree id="n25476" type="main" key="la^bellum1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăbellum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>1. labrum</etym>, <sense id="n25476.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little lip</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 4, 1, 52</bibl>: dentes illidunt saepe labellis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1080" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1080</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Platoni cum in cunis parvulo dormienti apes in labellis consedissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:36:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 36, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec te paeniteat calamo trivisse labellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: et roseo terit ore deus mollique labello, Pub. Syr. ap. Wernsd. <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> L. Min. 2, 388: <cit><quote lang="la">digito compesce labellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:160" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extendere,</quote> <trans><tr>to pout, thrust out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:325" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 325</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">compara labella cum labellis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>kiss</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 78</bibl></cit>.—As a term of endearment: <cit><quote lang="la">meus ocellus, meum labellum, mea salus, meum savium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 153</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 175</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25477" type="main" key="la^bellum2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăbellum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>2. labrum</etym>, <sense id="n25477.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small water-vessel, a tub, bathing-tub</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">labellum fictile novum impleto paleis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:44:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 44, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:28:3" default="NO">12, 28, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25477.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a small pan</hi> or <hi rend="ital">basin</hi> set on a tomb for use in libations, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:26:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 26, 66</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
labeo: <entryFree id="n25478" type="main" key="la^be^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăbĕo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n25478.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">amplif.</hi> [labium], <hi rend="ital">one who has large lips, who is blubber-lipped</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse quosdam capitones, frontones, labeones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 108</bibl></cit>; cf.: labio, Ver. Flac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 1, 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25479" type="main" key="La^be^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăbĕo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25479.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">labra, a quibus Brocchi Labeones dicti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 60, § 159</bibl></cit>.—Esp. a surname of the Antistii, Atinii, Fabii, and other Roman families; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Antistius Labeo,</quote> <trans><tr>a celebrated teacher of law in the time of Augustus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:10:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2:section=44" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2, § 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47" default="NO">47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:188" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 188</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
labeosus: <entryFree id="n25480" type="hapax" key="la^be^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăbĕōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>labeo, labio</etym>, <sense id="n25480.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having large lips, blubber-lipped</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">philema,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1169</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
laberius: <entryFree id="n25481" type="main" key="La^be^ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăbĕrĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n25481.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens; <cit><quote lang="la">so esp. D. Laberius,</quote> <trans><tr>a knight, celebrated as a composer of mimes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 39</bibl>; Sen. de Ira, 2, 11; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 7</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n25481.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lă-bĕrĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to</hi> D. Laberius, <hi rend="ital">Laberian</hi>: versus, Sen. de Ira, 2, 11, 4.</sense></entryFree>
labes: <entryFree id="n25482" type="main" key="la_bes1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lābes</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<case>abl.</case> labi for labe, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:930" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 930</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. lābor</etym>, <sense id="n25482.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fall, falling down, sinking in</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25482.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">dare labem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus terrae Rhodum ... gravi ruinarum labe concussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:4:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 30, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantos terrae motus in Italia factos esse, ut multis locis labes factae sint terraeque desederint,</quote> <trans><tr>subsidences of the earth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:35:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 35, 78</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">labes agri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 43, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 15</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si labes facta sit, omnemque fructum tulerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:15:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 15, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labes imbris e caelo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 185</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25482.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25482.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A fall, stroke, ruin, destruction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc mihi prima mali labes,</quote> <trans><tr>the first blow of misfortune</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec prima mali labes, hoc initium impendentis ruinae fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 17, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: metuo legionibu' labem, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 378</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 283 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">quanta pernis pestis veniet, quanta labes larido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">innocentiae labes ac ruina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labes in tabella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:12:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 12, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnorum labes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:237" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 237</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25482.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">ruin, destruction;</hi> of a dangerous person, one who causes ruin: <cit><quote lang="la">(Verres) labes atque pernicies provinciae Siciliae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: labes popli, Plant. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:3:4" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 3, 4</bibl>.—Of a bad law: <cit><quote lang="la">labes atque eluvies civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:20:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 20, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25482.5" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">the falling sickness, epilepsy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 57, 1018</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Hence, in gen.,</quote> <trans><tr>disease, sickness</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyneg. 468</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25483" type="main" key="la_bes2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lābes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">lw/bh, lwbeu/w</foreign>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Griech. Etym. p. 372" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Griech. Etym. p. 372</bibl></etym>. <sense id="n25483.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a spot, blot, stain, blemish, defect</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25483.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">tractata notam labemque remittunt Atramenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 235</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine labe toga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:514" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 514</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">purum et sine labe salinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:25" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victima labe carens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliqua corporis labe insignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 38</bibl></cit>: item quae (virgo) lingua debili sensuve aurium deminuta, aliave qua corporis labe insignita<cb n="LABI" />  sit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:12:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 12, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25483.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a stain, blot, stigma, disgrace, discredit</hi>: labes macula in vestimento dicitur, et deinde <foreign lang="greek">metaforikw=s</foreign> transfertur in homines vituperatione dignos, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=121" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 121</bibl> Müll. (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">animi labes nec diuturnitate evanescere, nec amnibus ullis elui potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:10:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saeculi labes atque macula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labem alicujus dignitati aspergere,</quote> <trans><tr>a stain, disgrace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labem alicui inferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:18:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 18, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famae non sine labe meae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 8, 20: <cit><quote lang="la">domus sine labe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:69" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita sine labe peracta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:7:49" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 7, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abolere labem prioris ignominiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donec longa dies ... concretam eximit labem, purumque relinquit sensum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:746" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 746</bibl></cit>. —Of an immoral custom: <cit><quote lang="la">dedit hanc contagio labem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:78" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 78</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conscientiae labes habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:21:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 21, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccatorum labibus inquinati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 26</bibl></cit>; id. Ira Dei, 19.—</sense><sense id="n25483.3" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (abstr. pro concreto), <hi rend="ital">a disgrace</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a good-for-nothing fellow, a wretch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">habeo quem opponam labi illi atque caeno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caenum illud ac labes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
labia: <entryFree id="n25484" type="main" key="la^bi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăbĭa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">lăbĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">lăbĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">la/ptw</foreign>; Lat. lambo, labrum, labeo; cf. Germ. Lippe; Engl. lip</etym>, <sense id="n25484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lip</hi> (form labia, ante- and post-class. for labrum; <cit><quote lang="la">labium, also post-Aug.: Verrius Flaccus sic distinxit, modica esse labra, labia immodica et inde labiones dici,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 79</bibl></cit> P.): <cit><quote lang="la">dejecta labia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 140</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>: labium, Seren. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 210, 21</bibl>.—More freq. in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">age tibicen: refer ad labias tibias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tremulus labeis demissis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 44</bibl></cit>; Nigid. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:4:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">labiae pendulae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 140</bibl></cit>. —Form labea, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 456, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">labearum ductu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:4:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 4, 6</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">salivosa labia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 313</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labiorum fissuris mederi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 3, 11, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulcera labiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 11, 27, § 115</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:160" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 160</bibl> dub.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Opif. D. 10, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:10:15" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 10, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:3:4" default="NO">15, 3, 4</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">labiis ductare aliquem,</quote> <trans><tr>to ridicule, make game of one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25484.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the axle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">some other part of an oil-press</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">labiam bifariam facito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 20, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
labici: <entryFree id="n25485" type="main" key="La^bi_ci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăbīci</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Lăvīci</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăbī-cum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:534" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 534</bibl>), <sense id="n25485.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Latium, between Tusculum and Præneste</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Colonna</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva Labici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:534" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 534</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n25485.1" n="II" level="1"> </sense><sense id="n25485.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăbīci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Labicum, the Labici</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">picti scuta Labici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:796" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 796</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:368" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 368</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25485.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăbī-cānus</orth> (scanned Lābīcānus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:89" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 89</bibl>), a, um, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Labicum, Labican</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <trans><tr>leading from Rome to Labicum</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicinitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 9, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25485.4" n="2" level="3"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n25485.5" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăbī-cāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Labicum, Labicans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25485.6" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lă-bīcānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. ager), <hi rend="ital">the territory of Labicum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">habuit fundum in Labicano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:3:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 6, 3, 50</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
labidus: <entryFree id="n25486" type="hapax" key="la_bi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lābĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. labor</etym>, <sense id="n25486.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">where one is apt to fall, slippery</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6</bibl></cit> prooem.</sense></entryFree>
labienus: <entryFree id="n25487" type="main" key="La^bi^e_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăbĭēnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25487.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several Romans</hi>. In partic., </sense><sense id="n25487.1" n="I" level="1"> T. Atius L., <hi rend="ital">a legate of Cæsar in Gaul, who afterwards went over to Pompey</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:ib. 8:52" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> ib. 8, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 11, 1</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n25487.2" n="B" level="2"> Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăbĭēnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Labienus</hi>: milites, Auct. B. Afr. 29, 2.— </sense><sense id="n25487.3" n="II" level="1"> Q. Atius L., <hi rend="ital">an uncle of the former, an adherent of Saturninus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:chapter=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 5</bibl> and 7.—</sense><sense id="n25487.4" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A rhetorician, who, from the boldness and fierceness of his disposition, was called</hi> Rabienus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 5 praef" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 5 praef.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
labilis: <entryFree id="n25488" type="main" key="la_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. labor</etym>, (post-class. for caducus, infirmus, debilis). <sense id="n25488.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Slipping, gliding, prone to slip</hi> or <hi rend="ital">slide</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25488.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">humus rivis operta sanguineis, gressus labiles evertebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 13, 6</bibl></cit>; Arnob. 2, 59.—</sense><sense id="n25488.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">fleeting, gliding, prone, transient, perishable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vitia labiles animae, Arnob. 2, 45: dulcedo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 4 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n25488.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Causing to slip, slippery</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">limus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 10, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 10, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence. <orth extent="full" lang="la">lābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adv., waveringly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Gen. ad Litt. B. 3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Gen. ad Litt. B. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
labina: <entryFree id="n25489" type="main" key="la_bi_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lābīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>labes</etym>, <sense id="n25489.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slippery place</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 16, 1, 4</bibl>. <cb n="LABO" /></sense></entryFree>
labio: <entryFree id="n25490" type="gloss" key="la^bi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăbĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>labium</etym>, <sense id="n25490.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having large lips, big-lipped</hi>, acc. to Verr. Fl. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 79</bibl> P.; v. labia <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
labiosus: <entryFree id="n25491" type="main" key="la^bi^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăbĭōsus</orth>, v. labeosus.</entryFree>
labium: <entryFree id="n25492" type="main" key="la^bi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăbĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. labia.</entryFree>
labo: <entryFree id="n25493" type="main" key="la^bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăbo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>from the same root as 1. labor</etym>, <sense id="n25493.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to totter, be ready to fall, begin to sink, to give way, be loosened</hi> (syn.: vacillo, titubo, nato). </sense><sense id="n25493.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: labat, labuntur saxa, caementae cadunt, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 196, 3</bibl> (Trag. v. 142 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">signum labat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:43:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 43, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ex ictu ... labant dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labat ariete crebro Janua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:492" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 492</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labant curvae naves,</quote> <trans><tr>roll</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pressaeque labant sub gurgite turres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:290" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 290</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(turris) qua summa labantis Juncturas tabulata dabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:463" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 463</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">littera labat,</quote> <trans><tr>written with a trembling hand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labare sermone,</quote> <trans><tr>to stutter, speak indistinctly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 22, 28, § 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si labat oculus et hac atque illac movetur,</quote> <trans><tr>is unsteady</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tarda trementi genua labant,</quote> <trans><tr>sink</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 432</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:676" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 676</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincla labant,</quote> <trans><tr>are loosed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 85</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of dying persons: <cit><quote lang="la">inde labant populi,</quote> <trans><tr>fall, sink</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 93</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia tum vero vitaï claustra lababant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1153</bibl></cit>.—With Gr. <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">egressi labant vestigia prima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 283</bibl></cit> Forbig. (Rib. egressisque).—</sense><sense id="n25493.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25493.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To waver, to be unstable, undecided, to hesitate</hi> (in opinion, resolution, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">si res labat, Itidem amici collabascunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">scito, labare meum consilium illud, quod satis jam fixum videbatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labamus mutamusque sententiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:32:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 32, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ei labare M. Antonius videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 6, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animumque labantem inpulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labantia corda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">socii labant,</quote> <trans><tr>waver in fidelity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 61</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fides sociorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:30:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 30, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus regis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quīs lababat fides,</quote> <trans><tr>whose fidelity was wavering</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:392" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 392</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:629" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 629</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu mente labantem dirige me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 244</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex nimia matrem pietate labare sensit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:629" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 629</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoria labat,</quote> <trans><tr>becomes weak</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mens in illis (phreneticis) labat, in hoc (cordiaco) constat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec dubium habebatur labare hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labante jam Agrippina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:14:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 14, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labantem ordinem contirmare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies labantes restituere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 8 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sustinere labantem aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25493.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To sink, fall to pieces, go to ruin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid non sic aliud ex alio nectitur, ut non, si unam litteram moveris, labent omnia?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:22:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 22, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes rei publicae partes aegras et labantes sanare et confirmare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:25:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 25, 68</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sustinuisse labantem fortunam populi Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicuti populo Romano sua fortuna labet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labante egregia quondam disciplina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum res Trojana labaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:437" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 437</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labantibus Vitellii rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid in moribus labaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
labor: <entryFree id="n25494" type="main" key="la_bor1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lābor</orth>, <itype>lapsus</itype> (<sense id="n25494.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. parag.</hi> labier, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 94</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">part.</hi> labundus, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 504, 31</bibl>; Trag. Fragm. v. 570 Rib.), 3, <hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [cf. lăbo; Sanscr. lamb- (ramb-), to glide, fall], <hi rend="ital">to move gently along a smooth surface, to fall, slide; to slide, slip</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">glide down, to fall down, to sink</hi> as the beginning of a fall; constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, or with <hi rend="ital">ad, in, inter, per, sub, super, ab, de, ex</hi>, or with <case>abl.</case> alone. </sense><sense id="n25494.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25494.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n25494.3" n="1" level="3"> Of living beings: <cit><quote lang="la">non squamoso labuntur ventre cerastae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 22, 27: <cit><quote lang="la">per sinus crebros et magna volumina labens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:721" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 721</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pigraque labatur circa donaria serpens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:13:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 13, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille inter vestes et levia pectora lapsus volvitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 349</bibl></cit>: (angues) in diversum lapsi, Jul. <bibl default="NO"><author>Obseq.</author> 119</bibl>.—Of floating: <cit><quote lang="la">ut rate felice pacata per aequora labar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum Stygio gurgite labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:504" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 504</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tua labens navita aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:26" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 26</bibl></cit> (3, 21), 8.—Of flying: <cit><quote lang="la">tollunt se celeres, liquidumque per aera lapsae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vade, age, nate, voca Zephyros et labere pennis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pennis lapsa per auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labere, nympha, polo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:588" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 588</bibl></cit>.—Of sinking, slipping down: <cit><quote lang="la">labor, io! cara lumina conde manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:7:342" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 7, 342</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labitur infelix (equus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:498" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 498</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:799" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 799</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">labitur exsanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:818" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 818</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 181</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">super terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:477" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 477</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:470" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 470</bibl></cit> <pb n="1024" /> <cb n="LABO" /> limite, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:712" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 712</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vulnera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:604" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 604</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in colla mariti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:425" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 425</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alieno vulnere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 265</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in rivo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pondere lapsi pectoris arma sonant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:572" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 572</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of gliding upwards: celeri fuga sub sidera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 243</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25494.4" n="2" level="3"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">splendida signa videntur labier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:445" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 445</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:18:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 18, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">umor in genas Furtim labitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 13, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellas Praecipites caelo labi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:366" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 366</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perque genas lacrimae labuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 185</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:656" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 656</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapsi de fontibus amnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:954" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 954</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">catenae lapsae lacertis sponte sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:699" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 699</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapsuram domum subire,</quote> <trans><tr>about to tumble down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:511" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ib. 511</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 25</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">with cado: multa in silvis Lapsa cadunt folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:310" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 310</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsaque in Oceanum sidera lapsa cadunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 4, 64: <cit><quote lang="la">lapsis repente saxis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab arbore ramus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:410" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 410</bibl></cit>.—Of the eyes, <hi rend="ital">to fall, close</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">labentes, oculos condere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:3:44" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 3, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:818" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 818</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:10:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 10, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:5:17" default="NO">2, 5, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25494.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25494.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To glide away, glide along, slip</hi> or <hi rend="ital">haste away</hi>: labitur uncta carina: volat super impetus undas, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 379 Vahl.); so id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 476 Vahl.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">labitur uncta vadis abies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 8, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidera, quae vaga et mutabili ratione labuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 10</bibl></cit>.—Esp., of a transition in discourse, <hi rend="ital">to pass</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a dispositione ad elocutionis praecepta labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 10, 17</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25494.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To slip away, escape</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapsus custodiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 5, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">e manibus custodientium lapsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:13:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 13, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:11:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 11, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 3, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25494.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25494.9" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to come</hi> or <hi rend="ital">go gently</hi> or <hi rend="ital">insensibly, to glide, glide</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pass away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ilico res foras labitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevitate et celeritate syllabarum labi putat verba proclivius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed labor longius, ad propositum revertor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:37:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 37, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:19:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 19, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">labitur occulte fallitque volubilis aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 8, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labi somnum sensit in artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:631" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 631</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostro illius labatur pectore vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25494.10" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n25494.11" n="1" level="3"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">to die away, be lost, not be heard</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ne adjectae voces laberentur atque errarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 114</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:745" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 745</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25494.12" n="2" level="3"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">to glide, pass away, elapse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eheu fugaces labuntur anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anni tacite labentis origo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:65" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labentia tempora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:771" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 771</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas labitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:48" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 8, 48</bibl></cit>; cf.: labente officio, <hi rend="ital">when the attendance</hi> or <hi rend="ital">service is ended</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:203" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 203</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25494.13" n="3" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to sink, incline, begin to fall, go to ruin, perish</hi>: quantis opibus, quibus de rebus lapsa fortuna accidat, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 19, 44</bibl> (Trag. v. 396 Vahl.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera nasci, occidere, fluere, labi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labentem et prope cadentem rem publicam fulcire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:21:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 21, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitem Romanum labentem excepit, fulsit, sustinuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:16:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 16, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. ad Brut. 1, 18, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sustinuit labentem aciem Antonius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidi labentes acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 2, 53: <cit><quote lang="la">eo citius lapsa res est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 33</bibl></cit>: mores lapsi sunt, id. praef.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides lapsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labentur opes,</quote> <trans><tr>will be lost</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:53" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hereditas lapsa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4:11:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 4, 11, § 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25494.14" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To slip</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fall away from</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">to lose</hi> it: hac spe lapsus, <hi rend="ital">deceived</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disappointed in this hope</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:55:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 55, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc munere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:740" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 740</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facultatibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to lose one's property, become poor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:8:2:section=11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 27, 8, 2, § 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:9:section=1" default="NO">26, 7, 9, § 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mente,</quote> <trans><tr>to lose one's senses, go mad</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 48</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lapsae mentis error,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:3:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">lapsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">ruined, unfortunate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:1:25" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 1, 25</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n25494.15" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To fall into</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon, to come</hi> or <hi rend="ital">turn to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor eo, ut assentiar Epicuro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 45, 139</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 5, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad opinionem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 45, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in adulationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in gaudia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:662" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 662</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vitium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 94</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25494.16" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To fall into error, to be mistaken, to err, mistake, commit a fault</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">labi, errare, nescire, decipi et malum et turpe ducimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:6:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliqua re labi et cadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:49:185" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 49, 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in minimis tenuissimisque rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:37:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 37, 169</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapsus est per errorem suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 9, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilio, ... casu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter inprudentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in officio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:4:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in verbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne verbo quidem labi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">it vera ratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2</bibl></cit>, <cb n="LABO" /> 176.—</sense><sense id="n25494.17" n="7" level="3"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to fall away from the true faith, to become apostate</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">lapsorum fratrum petulantia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Ep. 30, 1 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25495" type="main" key="la^bor2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăbor</orth> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">lăbos</orth>, <itype>like arbos, honos</itype>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 6</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 487, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:55:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 55, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 7, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 100:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 100, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 13</bibl>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. root rabh, to grasp, ā-rabh, to undertake; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)lf</foreign>- in <foreign lang="greek">h)=lfon</foreign>, earned, <foreign lang="greek">a)/lfhma</foreign>, wages; Germ. Arbeit</etym>, <sense id="n25495.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">labor, toil, exertion</hi> (cf.: contentio, opera). </sense><sense id="n25495.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ingenium est omnium Hominum a labore proclive ad libidinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud existimans quanto labore partum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interest aliquid inter laborem et dolorem: sunt finitima omnino, sed tamen differt aliquid. Labor est functio quaedam vel animi vel corporis, gravioris operis et muneris: dolor autem motus asper in corpore alienus a sensibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:15:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 15, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:17:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 17, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res est magni laboris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:33:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 33, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laborem sibi sumere et alteri imponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:18:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 18, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumptum et laborem insumere in rem aliquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:38:113" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 38, 113</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:98:section=227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 98, § 227</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum operae laborisque consumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:55:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 55, 234</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laborem sustinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exantlare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 34, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suscipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:Or. 5:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. Or. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 15, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:16:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 16, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labores magnos excipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:69:243" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 69, 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in magnis laboribus exercere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 11, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summi laboris esse,</quote> <trans><tr>capable of great exertion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laborem levare alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:34:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 34, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">detrahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex labore se reficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">victus suppeditabatur sine labore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:48:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 48, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est quod existumes, ullam esse sine labore virtutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 25:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 25, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:12:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 12, 12</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo labore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:34:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 34, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:40:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 40, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:22:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 22, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum meruit labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:216" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reddere sua dona labori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:16:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 16, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerenter labores,</quote> <trans><tr>be valued</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25495.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n25495.3" n="1" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">drudgery, hardship, fatigue, distress, trouble, pain, suffering</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and late Lat.; syn. aerumna): decet id pati animo aequo; <cit><quote lang="la">si id facietis, levior labos erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter meum caput labores homini evenisse optumo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum labore magno et misere vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:prol. 14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. prol. 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc evenit in labore atque in dolore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel in labore meo vel in honore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Iliacos audire labores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mox et frumentis labor additus, ut mala culmos Esset rubigo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli labores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 126</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 619</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 727: labor militiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:16:52" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 16, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castrorum labores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:198" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lucinae labores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 340</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cor de labore pectus tundit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc medicamentum sine magno labore cadere cogit haemorrhoidas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:227" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterarius, = opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 9:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 9, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">id. cont. Jul. 6, 21: meos labores legere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Don. Pers. 68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Don. Pers. 68</bibl></cit>.—Of sickness: valetudo crescit, accrescit labor. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sulphurosi fontes labores nervorum reficiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—Of danger: <cit><quote lang="la">maximus autem earum (apium) labor est initio veris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:13:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">jucundi acti labores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:32:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 32, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suavis laborum est praeteritorum memoria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n25495.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25495.5" n="a" level="4"> Labores solis, <hi rend="ital">eclipses of the sun</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:742" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 742</bibl> Forbig. ad loc.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">defectus solis varios lunaeque labores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:478" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 478</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:378" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 378</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n25495.6" n="b" level="4"> Of plants: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc laborem perferre,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>growth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:343" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 343</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25495.7" n="3" level="3"> Personified: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăbos</orth>, <hi rend="ital">toil, in the lower world</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 277</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25495.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, of the products of labor. </sense><sense id="n25495.9" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Work, workmanship</hi> of an artist (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">operum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:455" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 455</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic labor ille domūs,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec non Polycleti multus ubique labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:104" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 104</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n25495.10" n="b" level="4"> Of cultivated plants, crops, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ruit arduus aether et pluvia ingenti sata laeta boumque labores Diluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 325</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec cum sint hominumque boumque labores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 118</bibl></cit>: Juppiter Grandine dilapidans hominumque boumque labores, Col. poët. 10, 330; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 284</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">306</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25495.11" n="c" level="4"> Labores uteri, i. e. <hi rend="ital">children</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 193</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
laboratio: <entryFree id="n25496" type="hapax" key="la^bo_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăbōrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>laboro</etym>, <sense id="n25496.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">labor, toil</hi>, Front. Hist. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
laboratus: <entryFree id="n25497" type="main" key="la^bo_ra_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăbōrātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25497.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">labor, laboriousness</hi> (late Lat.), Ven. v. Rad. 13. <cb n="LABO" /></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25498" type="main" key="la^bo_ra_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăbōrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>laboro</etym>. <sense id="n25498.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Labored, attended with labor</hi> or <hi rend="ital">difficulty</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">laboratior continentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Verg. Vel. 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25498.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Laborious, troublesome, miserable, full of hardship</hi> (in post-Aug. poets): <cit><quote lang="la">aevum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:255" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 255</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:341" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 341</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
laboriae: <entryFree id="n25499" type="main" key="La^bo_ri^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăbōrĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, v. Laborinus.</entryFree>
laborifer: <entryFree id="n25500" type="main" key="la^bo_ri^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăbōrĭfer</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. labor-fero</etym>, <sense id="n25500.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">labor-bearing, toil-enduring</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Hercules,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 285</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvencus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:129" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:25" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
laborinus: <entryFree id="n25501" type="main" key="La^bo_ri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăbōrīnus campus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăbō-rĭāni campi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăbōrĭae</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Leb-</orth>), <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n25501.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a district in Campania, lying around Capua and Nola</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Terra di Lavoro</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:28" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 4, 3, § 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:111" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 11, 29, § 111</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
laboriose: <entryFree id="n25502" type="main" key="la^bo_ri^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăbōrĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. laboriosus <sense id="n25502.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
laboriosus: <entryFree id="n25503" type="main" key="la^bo_ri^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăbōrĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. labor</etym>, <sense id="n25503.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of labor, laborious</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25503.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Attended with much labor, laborious, toilsome, wearisome, difficult, troublesome</hi> (syn. operosus): <cit><quote lang="la">deambulatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil laboriosius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:8:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operum longe maximum ac laboriosissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: si qua laboriosa est (fabula), ad me curritur, <hi rend="ital">difficult to put on the stage</hi>, opp. lenis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. prol. 44</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25503.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25503.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Inclined to labor, laborious, industrious</hi>, for the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">filo/ponos</foreign> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">impiger, industrius): homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:15:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 15, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bos laboriosissimus hominis socius in agricultura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6 praef" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6 praef.</bibl></cit> § 7.—</sense><sense id="n25503.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That undergoes much trouble and hardship, troubled, harassed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid enim nobis duobus laboriosius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 4, 4</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lăbōrĭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">laboriously, wearisomely, with difficulty</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 17, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:38:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 38, 1</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 11, 31</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laboriosissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:21:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 21, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:43 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 43 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
