laboro: <entryFree id="n25504" type="main" key="la^bo_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăbōro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n25504.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [2. labor]. </sense><sense id="n25504.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to labor, take pains, exert one's self, strive</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25504.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne labora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese (aratores) sibi, laborare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:52:section=121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 52, § 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ego laboravi, aut quid egi, aut in quo evigilaverunt curae et cogitationes meae, si? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:2:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne familiares, si scuta ipsi ferrent, laborarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si mea res esset, non magis laborarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui non satis laborarunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl></cit> prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">29: frustra laborabimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 35</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">frustra laboret Ausus idem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 241</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in enodandis nominibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to exert one's self in vain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:24:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 24, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa memoriam et pronuntiationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa nomina rerum ambitiose,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 11, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in famam, Sen. de Ira, 3, 41, 3: in commune,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:18" default="NO">8, 2, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in spem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:367" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 367</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat., to toil for, to serve</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui (Jovi) tertia regna laborant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:116" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 116</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est, in quo se laborasse dicit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:53:section=124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 53, § 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua in re mihi non arbitror diu laborandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in dura humo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:416" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 416</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in remigando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:6:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 6, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omni gente,</quote> <trans><tr>in behalf of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:239" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 239</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">pro</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro hoc (L. Flacco) laborant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 11, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro salute mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 11, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro Sestio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laborabat, ut reliquas civitates adjungeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut honore dignus essem, maxime semper laboravi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:20:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 20, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vos decerneretis laboravi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 11, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque te ut miretur turba labores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 73</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et sponsio illa ne fieret, laborasti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:57:section=132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 57, § 132</bibl></cit>: quae ego ne frustra subierim ... laboro, Lent. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 14, 5</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem perspexisse laborant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:435" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 435</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amarique ab eo laboravi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 5, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si sociis fidelissimis prospicere non laboratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:55:section=127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 55, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod audiri non laborarit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc superare laboret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:41:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 41, 112</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 269</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quaerere quidem de tanta re laborarint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,016:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pel. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">describere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25504.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n25504.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To suffer, to labor under, to be oppressed, afflicted</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">troubled with</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25504.5" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: aliud est dolere, aliud laborare. Cum varices secabantur C. Mario, dolebat: cum aestu magno ducebat agmen, laborabat. Est mter haec tamen quaedam similitudo: consuetudo enim laborum perpessionem dolorum efficiet faciliorem, Cic. <pb n="1025" /> <cb n="LABR" /> Tusc. 2, 15, 35: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudo tua me valde conturbat: significant enim tuae litterae, te prorsus laborare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Att. 7:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sine febri laborassem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 5:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum graviter esse aegrum, quod vehementer ejus artus laborarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tusc. 2:25:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 25, 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25504.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex intestinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex pedibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex renibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:25:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 25, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e dolore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 33</bibl></cit>.—Esp. of mental disorders, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex invidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:71:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 71, 202</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:51:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 51, 149</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex desiderio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex inscitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex aere alieno laborare,</quote> <trans><tr>to be oppressed with debt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25504.7" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a re frumentaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab avaritia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25504.8" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">laborantes utero puellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domesticā crudelitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:53:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 53, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero quisquam stultus non horum morborum aliquo laborat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:18:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 18, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odio apud hostes, contemptu inter socios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pestilentiā laboratum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:31:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 31, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimine temeritatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 9, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25504.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To grieve, be in trouble, be vexed, to be concerned, solicitous</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">anxious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo laborabat, ut reliquas civitates adjungeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vos decerneretis, laboravi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:chapter=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil laboro, nisi ut salvus sis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponsio illa ne fieret laborasti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:57:section=132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 57, § 132</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">de</hi> (esp. of events or persons <hi rend="ital">on whose account</hi> one is concerned): <cit><quote lang="la">sororem de fratrum morte laborantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:26:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 26, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de quibus ego ante laborabam, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laboro, ut non minimum hac mea commendatione se consecutum videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 26, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noli putare me de ulla re magis laborare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his de rebus eo magis laboro, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:56:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 56, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in uno,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to love</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 17, 19</bibl></cit>: non laboro, nihil laboro, <hi rend="ital">I don't trouble myself about it, it concerns me not</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus manu sit percussus, non laboro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:34:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 34, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorsum recidat responsum tuum non magnopere laboro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 15, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tironi prospicit, de se nihil laborat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est quod de iis laborat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 8, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:43:103" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 43, 103</bibl>.—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuā causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neglegens ne qua populus laborat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 8, 25</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in re familiari valde laboramus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25504.10" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be in distress, difficulty</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">danger</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos laborantes conspexerat iis subsidia submittebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suis laborantibus succurrere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 60:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 60, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne legatus laborantibus suis auxilio foret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 52:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 52, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:1:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 1, 15</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxime ad superiores munitiones laboratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 85</bibl></cit>.—Of inanim. things: <cit><quote lang="la">ut utraeque (triremes) ex concursu laborarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec cur fraternis luna laboret equis (of an eclipse of the moon, because the sun's light is then withdrawn from it),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:34:52" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 34, 52</bibl></cit> (3, 32, 48 M.); so, <cit><quote lang="la">luna laboret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:38:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 38, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum luna laborare non creditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 9, 6, § 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laboranti succurrere lunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:443" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 443</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aquilonibus Querceta laborant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laborantem ratem deserere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:6:22" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laborat carmen in fine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25504.11" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> (only since the Aug. per.; for in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:22:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 22, 54</bibl>, elaboratus is the correct reading). </sense><sense id="n25504.12" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To work out, elaborate, to form, make, prepare</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctibus hibernis castrensia pensa laboro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:3:33" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quale non perfectius Meae laborarint manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:60" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arte laboratae vestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:639" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 639</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laborata Ceres,</quote> <trans><tr>bread</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et nobis et equis letum commune laboras,</quote> <trans><tr>preparest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:411" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 411</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25504.13" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To labor at, to cultivate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenta ceterosque fructus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
labos: <entryFree id="n25505" type="main" key="la^bos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăbos</orth>, v. 2. labor <sense id="n25505.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
labosus: <entryFree id="n25506" type="hapax" key="la^bo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăbōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>labos for labor</etym>, <sense id="n25506.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">laborious, troublesome</hi>: iter labosum, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 489, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
labrandius: <entryFree id="n25507" type="main" key="Labrandi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Labrandĭus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Labradius</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lă-brăyndus</orth>, <sense id="n25507.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*labra/ndeos</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">*labra/deos</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">a surname of Jupiter, derived from the town of Labranda, in Caria, where there was a temple to him</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 13</bibl> (<bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Euhem. 52, p. 173</bibl> Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">in Labrayndi Jovis fonte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 2, 7, § 16</bibl></cit> Jan.</sense></entryFree>
labratum: <entryFree id="n25508" type="gloss" key="labratum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">labratum</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">a)spastiko\n basile/ws</foreign>: ‡ labratum, <foreign lang="greek">fi/lhma basiliko/n</foreign> (perh. for osculum labratum), Vet. Gloss.</entryFree>
labro: <entryFree id="n25509" type="main" key="Labro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Labro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, prob. <sense id="n25509.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seaport in Etruria, where stands the modern Livorno (Leghorn)</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 6, 2</bibl>. <cb n="LABY" /></sense></entryFree>
labros: <entryFree id="n25510" type="greek" key="la_bros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lābros</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>, = <foreign lang="greek">la/bros</foreign> (greedy). <sense id="n25510.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fish</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 54, § 152</bibl> (Jahn, melanarum).—</sense><sense id="n25510.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lā-bros</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the name of a dog</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 224</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
labrosus: <entryFree id="n25511" type="hapax" key="la^bro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăbrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. labrum</etym>, <sense id="n25511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with large lips</hi>: ferramentum, <hi rend="ital">with a large rim</hi> or <hi rend="ital">border</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 26, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
labrum: <entryFree id="n25512" type="main" key="la_^brum1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lā^brum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>root lab, as in labium; v. lambo</etym>, <sense id="n25512.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lip.</hi> </sense><sense id="n25512.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cape cultrum ac seca digitum vel nasum vel labrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes, quas dixisti in labris Platonis consedisse pueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:31:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 31, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vide ut discidit labrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labrum superius,</quote> <trans><tr>the upper lip</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(poculis) labra admovere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labra movere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:114" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 114</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive puer furens impressit memorem dente labris notam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 13, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ego mecum Compressis agito labris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 4, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labra distorquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labra male porrigere, scindere, adstringere, diducere, replicare, in latus trahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 81</bibl></cit>: labra labris conserere, <hi rend="ital">to kiss</hi>, Cn. Matius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:9:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">labra labellis ferrummare,</quote> <trans><tr>to kiss</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 25</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">labra ad labella adjungere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labra valgiter commovere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viscantur labra mariti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:466" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 466</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25512.2" n="B" level="2"> Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">linere alicui labra,</quote> <trans><tr>to deceive one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:42:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 42, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non in pectore, sed in labris habere bonitatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primis or primoribus labris gustare, or attingere aliquid,</quote> <trans><tr>to get a slight taste of, to get only a superficial knowledge of a thing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:8:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae ipsi rhetores ne primoribus quidem labris attigissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:19:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 19, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multos vidi qui primoribus labris gustassent genus hoc vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 12, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non a summis labris venire,</quote> <trans><tr>not to be lightly spoken</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 10:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 10, 3</bibl></cit>: similem habent labra lactucam, a saying of M. Crassus when he saw an ass eating thistles, and which may be rendered, <hi rend="ital">like lips, like lettuce;</hi> meaning, <hi rend="ital">like has met its like</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 7, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25512.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25512.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An edge, margin, brim</hi> (of a vessel, a ditch, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut ejus fossae solum tantundem pateret, quantum summa labra distarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra duplex vallum fossae circumdedit, interiore labro murum objecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:37:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 37, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labra doliorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 107, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 2, 19, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lilium resupinis per ambitum labris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 5, 11, § 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:168" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 22, 35, § 168</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n25512.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a trench</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> de Clar. Urb. 5, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25512.6" n="C" level="2"> Labrum Venerium, <hi rend="ital">a plant growing by rivers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 108, § 171</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also labrum Veneris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 1038</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25513" type="main" key="la_brum2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lābrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>for lavabrum, q. v.</etym>, <sense id="n25513.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a basin, a tub</hi> for bathing; <hi rend="ital">a vat</hi> for treading out grapes: <cit><quote lang="la">labrum si in balineo non est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmoreo labro aqua exundat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">splendentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 417</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aëna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmorea duo labra ante fornicem posuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unda labris nitentibus instat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:5:49" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 5, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eluacrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lupinarium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olearium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50:10 sq" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 50, 10 sq.</bibl>; cf.: spumat plenis vindemia labris, <hi rend="ital">in the full vats</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vessels</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 6</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a tub or basin for bathing,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 10, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a fountain,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 1, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25513.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf., <hi rend="ital">a bath</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec Dryades, nec nos videamus labra Dianae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:761" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 761</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:481" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ib. 481</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 21, 178</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
labrus: <entryFree id="n25514" type="main" key="la_brus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lābrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. labros.</entryFree>
labrusca: <entryFree id="n25515" type="main" key="la_brusca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lābrusca</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ae</orth>) <orth extent="full" lang="la">vītis</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">ūva</orth>; also <sense id="n25515.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lābrusca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the wild vine, claret-vine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis labrusca, Linn.: uva labrusca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis labrusca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 13, 28, § 48</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspice ut antrum Sylvestris raris sparsit labrusca racemis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 7</bibl></cit> Serv. ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 14, § 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omphacium ... fit e labrusca, hoc est vite sylvestri, quod vocatur oenanthinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 16, 18, § 98</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
labruscum: <entryFree id="n25516" type="main" key="la_bruscum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lābruscum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>labrusca</etym>, <sense id="n25516.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the fruit of the</hi> labrusca, <hi rend="ital">the wild grape</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
labundus: <entryFree id="n25517" type="hapax" key="la_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. labor</etym>, <sense id="n25517.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">falling</hi>: unda, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 504, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
laburnum: <entryFree id="n25518" type="main" key="laburnum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laburnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n25518.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the broad-leaved beantrefoil</hi>: Cytisus laburnum, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 18, 31, § 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:174" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 22, 35, § 174</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
labyrinthus: <entryFree id="n25519" type="main" key="la^by^rinthus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăbyrinthus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">labu/rinqos</foreign>, <sense id="n25519.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a labyrinth, a building with many winding passages;</hi> e. g. <hi rend="ital">that built by Psammetichus on Lake Mœris, in Middle Egypt, and containing</hi><cb n="LACE" />  3000 <hi rend="ital">chambers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:9:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 13, 19, § 84</bibl>; but esp. <hi rend="ital">that built by Dædalus, near Gnossus, in Crete</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 13, 19, § 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 44:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 44, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 159</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:53" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:588" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 588</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25519.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a maze, tangle, bewildering intricacy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inextricabilis negotii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25519.2" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n25519.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lăbyrinthēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a labyrinth, labyrinthine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flexus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 114</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25519.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lăbyrinthĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of a labyrinth, labyrinthine, intricate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestionum insolubilitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lac: <entryFree id="n25520" type="main" key="lac"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lac</orth>, <itype>lactis</itype> (<case>nom.</case> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lacte</orth>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 483, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 16</bibl> Ritschl <sense id="n25520.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> al.; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">lact</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 307</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">masc. acc.</hi> lactem, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 214 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">215</bibl> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; but dub. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 1, 17</bibl>, where Hertz reads lacte), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ga/la</foreign>, gen. <foreign lang="greek">ga/lakt-os</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">milk</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25520.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulci repletur lacte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:814" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 814</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum lacte nutricis errorem suxisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacte vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lac mihi non aestate novum, non frigore defit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concretum vimine querno lac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:437" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 437</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lactis inopia ... abundantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:12:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a lacte cunisque,</quote> <trans><tr>from the cradle, from infancy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lac pressum,</quote> <trans><tr>cheese</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coagulatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 7, 64, § 128</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">tam similem quam lacte lacti'st,</quote> <trans><tr>as like as one egg is to another</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 85</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">neque lac lacti magis est simile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 1, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 9, 30</bibl>: lac gallinaceum, <hi rend="ital">chicken's milk</hi>, of something very rare, Plin. N. H. praef. § 23; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 38, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui plus lactis quam sanguinis habet,</quote> <trans><tr>of tender age</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:68" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 68</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25520.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, for something sweet, pleasant: in melle sunt linguae sitae nostrae atque orationes, lacteque; <cit><quote lang="la">corda felle sunt lita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut mentes ... satiari velut quodam jucundioris disciplinae lacte patiantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25520.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25520.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Milky juice, milk</hi> of plants: <cit><quote lang="la">herbae, nigri cum lacte veneni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:514" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 514</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:606" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 606</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenero dum lacte, quod intro est, id. Nux, 95: ficulneum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:8:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caprifici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25520.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Milk-white color</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): candidus taurus ... una fuit labes; <cit><quote lang="la">cetera lactis erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 290</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lacaena: <entryFree id="n25521" type="main" key="La^caena"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăcaena</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*la/kaina</foreign>, <sense id="n25521.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Spartan, Lacedæmonian;</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subst., a Lacedæmonian</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Spartan woman</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25521.1" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): apud Lacaenas virgines, quibus magis palaestra studio est, etc., <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:15:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 15, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virginibus bacchata Lacaenis Taygeta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:487" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 487</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyndaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:601" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 601</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 3, 300</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25521.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst., a Spartan woman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualis tandem Lacaena, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:42:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 42, 102</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">of Helen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:601" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 601</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 511</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">of Clytemnestra</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:150" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 150</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">of Leda</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:103:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 103, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lacca: <entryFree id="n25522" type="main" key="lacca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lacca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n25522.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A swelling on the shinbone of draught-cattle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 27, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25522.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
laccar: <entryFree id="n25523" type="main" key="laccar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laccar</orth>, <itype>ăris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n25523.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 2, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lacedaemon: <entryFree id="n25524" type="main" key="La^ce^daemo_^n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăcĕdaemō^n</orth> (<case>nom.</case> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăcĕdaemo</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:15:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 15, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:33:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 33, 50</bibl>), <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lakedai/mwn</foreign>, <sense id="n25524.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the city of Lacedæmon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Sparta</hi>, near the modern <hi rend="ital">Mistra</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:15:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 15, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:33:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 33, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 10</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Lacedaemonis moenia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsidio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 33</bibl></cit>; <case>acc.</case> Lacedaemonem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 8, 13, § 34</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">acc. Graec.</hi> Laceuaemona, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:363" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 363</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> Lacedaemone, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:27:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 27, 77</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">locat.</hi> Lacedaemoni, Nep. praef. 4.—</sense><sense id="n25524.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n25524.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăcĕdaemŏnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Lacedæmonians</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemini illi reges Lacedaemones Heraclidae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mamert.</author> Pan. ad Maxim. 9, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25524.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăcĕdaemŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Lacedæmonian, Spartan</hi>: mulier, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Helen</hi>, Enn. ap. Div. 1, 50, 114 (Trag. v. 93 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">Tarentum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>founded by Spartans</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galesus,</quote> <trans><tr>that flows near Tarentum</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:43:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 43, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 7, 11, § 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>floor of Laconian marble</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:175" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 175</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăcĕdaemŏnĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Lacedæmonians, Spartans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:43:95 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 43, 95 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:42:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 42, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:9:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 9, 15</bibl> et saep. —<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lacedaimonius quidam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:42:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 42, 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lacer: <entryFree id="n25525" type="main" key="la^cer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcer</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcĕrus</orth> quoted by <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 901</bibl> <pb n="1026" /> <cb n="LACE" /> P.), <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root <foreign lang="greek">lak</foreign>-, to tear; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">lakero/s</foreign>, torn; <foreign lang="greek">la/kkos</foreign>, lake; Lat. lacero, lacus, lacuna, lāma; Irish, loch; Engl. lake</etym>, <sense id="n25525.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mangled, lacerated, torn to pieces</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25525.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 403</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 63, 63, § 156</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus verberibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:4:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 21, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: cui quod membrum lacerum laesumve est, Masur. Sab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:2:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 2, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Deiphobum lacerum crudeliter ora,</quote> <trans><tr>mutilated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:495" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 495</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">artus avolsaque membra et funus lacerum tellus habet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 491</bibl></cit>.—Of the hair: <cit><quote lang="la">nec modus aut pennis, laceris aut crinibus, ignem spargere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:1:133" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 1, 133</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:560" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 560</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 177</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tectorum vestigia lacera et semusta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 15, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insignia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:8" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacerae unguibus venae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phoen. 162" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Phoen. 162</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25525.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (postAug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">sparsas, atque, ut ita dicam, laceras gentilitates colligere atque conectere,</quote> <trans><tr>families rent and scattered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:39:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 39, 3</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra,</quote> <trans><tr>an army that has lost its general</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:9" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacerae domus artus componere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 432" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 432</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n25525.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">act., rending, lacerating</hi> (for lacerans): <cit><quote lang="la">morsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:880" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 880</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lacerabilis: <entryFree id="n25526" type="hapax" key="la^ce^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcĕrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lacero</etym>, <sense id="n25526.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be easily lacerated</hi> or <hi rend="ital">torn to pieces</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 15, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
laceratio: <entryFree id="n25527" type="main" key="la^ce^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25527.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tearing, rending, mangling, lacerating, laceration</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:18:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 18, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7</bibl></cit>. 4.—Concr.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia loca crinium laceratione complere,</quote> <trans><tr>the tearings of her hair</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,019:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Esth. 14, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">muliebres lacerationes genarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:26:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 26, 62</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lacerator: <entryFree id="n25528" type="main" key="la^ce^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcĕrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25528.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mangler, lacerater</hi> (late Lat.), of a violent critic, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Mor. Eccl. Cath. 1" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Mor. Eccl. Cath. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
laceratrix: <entryFree id="n25529" type="main" key="la^ce^ra_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcĕrātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>lacerator</etym>, <sense id="n25529.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that lacerates</hi> (late Lat.), Macer. Carm. 2, 6.</sense></entryFree>
lacerna: <entryFree id="n25530" type="main" key="la^cerna1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcerna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">r(a/kos</foreign>, and lacer</etym>, <sense id="n25530.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of cloak which the Romans wore over the toga on journeys, or in damp and cold weather</hi>. To wear a lacerna in common was regarded as disgraceful: <cit><quote lang="la">cum calceis et toga, nullis nec Gallicis nec lacerna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:30:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 30, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotium aedilibus dedit, ne quem paterenter in foro circove, nisi positis lacernis, togatum consistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Gallicis, inquit, et lacerna cucurristi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:21:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 21, 6</bibl></cit>. Worn in the theatre as a protection against the weather, but thrown off on the appearance of the emperor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:137" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 137</bibl> <hi rend="ital">lemm.</hi> Sometimes wrapped around the head: <cit><quote lang="la">odoratum caput obscurante lacerna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:70:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 70, 2</bibl>. Usually of white cloth, rarely black, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:2:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 2, 2</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 114:21" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 114, 21</bibl>; v. also <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">foeda et scissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:148" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 148</bibl></cit>. Also used in the army, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 3, 18; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:745" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 745</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:80:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 80, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 24, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitem trita donare lacerna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:54" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 54</bibl></cit>; cf. Becker's Gallus, 3, p. 123 sq.; and v. Dict. Antiq. s. v.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25531" type="main" key="La^cerna2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăcerna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25531.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a rich charioteer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:114" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 114</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lacernatus: <entryFree id="n25532" type="main" key="la^cerna_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcernātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lacerna</etym>, <sense id="n25532.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wearing a</hi> lacerna (not ante-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:80:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 80, 3</bibl>: lacernata amica, prob. <hi rend="ital">the eunuch Sporus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:62" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 62</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 24, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lacernula: <entryFree id="n25533" type="main" key="la^cernu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcernŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25533.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small</hi> lacerna, <hi rend="ital">a little cloak</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 56</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lacero: <entryFree id="n25534" type="main" key="la^ce^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>lacer</etym>, <sense id="n25534.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to tear to pieces, to mangle, rend, mutilate, lacerate</hi> (class., esp. in the trop. sense; syn.: lanio, discerpo). </sense><sense id="n25534.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin spolies, mutiles, laceres quemquam nacta sis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: lacerat lacertum Largi mordax Memmius, Crass. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:59:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 59, 240</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus uti volucres lacerent in morte feraeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:880" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 880</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra aliena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:102" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 102</bibl></cit>; cf.: lacerato corpore, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 2</bibl> (Trag. v. 95 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">morsu viscera, Cic. poët. Tusc. 2, 8: ora, comas, vestem lacerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:726" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 726</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:389" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 389</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:3:51" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbere terga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:695" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 695</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tum autem Syrum impulsorem, vah, quibus illum lacerarem modis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tergum virgis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:13" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguibus cavos recessus luminum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 968" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 968</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid miserum laceras?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loricam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 98</bibl></cit>: lacerari morsibus saevis<cb n="LACE" />  canum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 12, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferae corpus lacerabant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 115 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnes dentibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 13, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:40:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Gen. 40, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25534.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n25534.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To break up, to wreck, shatter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">navem Ulixis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:6:19" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majorem partem classis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:79:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 79, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navigia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lecticam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:91" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 91</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25534.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To cut up, carve</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsonium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anserem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 137</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">74</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25534.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To waste, plunder</hi>: cum Hannibal terram Italiam laceraret atque vexaret, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. E. 6, 7, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:37" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25534.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25534.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To tear to pieces</hi> with words, <hi rend="ital">to censure, asperse, abuse, rail at</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtrectatio invidiaque, quae solet lacerare plerosque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:42:156" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 42, 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimum virum verborum contumeliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem probris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeium dempto metu lacerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:61:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 61, 21</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">meque vosque male dictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 85, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famam alicujus,</quote> <trans><tr>to slander, calumniate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:38:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus carmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:16:1" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacerari crebro vulgi rumore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 73</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25534.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To distress, torture, pain, afflict</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intolerabili dolore lacerari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam omni crudelitate lacerastis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:23:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 23, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid laceras pectora nostra morā?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meus me maeror cottidianus lacerat et conficit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aegritudo lacerat, exest animum planeque conficit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:13:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 13, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25534.9" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To ruin, destroy, dissipate, squander, waste</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">male suadendo et lustris lacerant homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriam omni scelere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:17:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 17, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonorum emptores, ut carnifices, ad reliquias vitae lacerandas et distrahendas,</quote> <trans><tr>to scatter, disperse</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 15, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam,</quote> <trans><tr>to squander</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:70:section=164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 70, § 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacerari valde suam rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 1, 48</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bona patria manu, ventre,</quote> <trans><tr>to lavish, squander</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem,</quote> <trans><tr>to waste</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 3, 1, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lacerta: <entryFree id="n25535" type="main" key="la^certa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcerta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcertus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n25535.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A lizard</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacerta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 39, 60, § 141</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 458</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:23:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 23, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:172" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 172</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:75" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacertus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:131" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 131</bibl>; cf. Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:231" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 231</bibl>. —Prov.: unius sese dominum fecisse lacertae, <hi rend="ital">to get a little place of one's own</hi> (if only big enough for a lizard), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:231" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 231</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n25535.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sea-fish</hi>, otherwise unknown: <cit><quote lang="la">lacertus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 149</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:48:11 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 48, 11 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacerta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:9:3:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 9, 3, § 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lacertosus: <entryFree id="n25536" type="main" key="la^certo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcertōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. lacertus</etym>, <sense id="n25536.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">muscular, brawny, powerful</hi> (cf. nervosus): <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 13</bibl></cit>: centuriones, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 9, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:9:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colonus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lacertulus: <entryFree id="n25537" type="main" key="la^certu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcertŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>lacertus</etym>, <sense id="n25537.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little arm;</hi> only transf., <hi rend="ital">a small cake</hi> (from its shape), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 245, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lacertus: <entryFree id="n25538" type="main" key="la^certus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcertus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25538.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the muscular part of the arm, from the shoulder to the elbow, the upper arm</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25538.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, opp. bracchium, the forearm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:829" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 829</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">laudat digitosque manusque, Bracchiaque et nudos mediā plus parte lacertos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:501" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 501</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">subjecta lacertis brachia sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:304" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 304</bibl></cit>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl> prooem. 19: <cit><quote lang="la">brachia quoque et lacertos auro colunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:9:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 9, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25538.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25538.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The arm</hi> (esp. as brawny, muscular): <cit><quote lang="la">nam scutum gladium galeam in onere nostri milites non plus numerant quam umeros, lacertos, manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:16:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 16, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Milo Crotoniates nobilitatus ex lateribus et lacertis suis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excusso lacerto telum torquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:18" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 18</bibl> (3, 15), 37: <cit><quote lang="la">lacertos collo imponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacerto jaculari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:8:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 8, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">candida cingantur colla lacertis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:457" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 457</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laevus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:693" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 693</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adducto contortum hastile lacerto immittit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:561" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 561</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secto requiem sperare lacerto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:106" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 106</bibl></cit>. —Of bees: <cit><quote lang="la">spicula exacuunt rostris, aptantque lacertos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>make trial of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25538.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25538.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A blow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cast</hi> from a strong arm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:562" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 562</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:262" default="NO">1, 262</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25538.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">muscular power, muscle, strength, military force</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Lysia saepe sunt lacerti, sic ut fieri nihil possit valentius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:16:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 16, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastas oratoris lacertis viribusque torquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:57:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 57, 242</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me civilis tulit aestus in arma, Caesaris Augusti non responsura lacertis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 48</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Flor. prooem. § 8: viribus confisus admirandisque lacertis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:11" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 11</bibl></cit>. <cb n="LACI" /></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25539" type="main" key="la^certus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcertus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <sense id="n25539.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lizard; a sea-fish;</hi> v. lacerta.</sense></entryFree>
lacessitio: <entryFree id="n25540" type="hapax" key="la^cessi_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcessītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>lacesso</etym>, <sense id="n25540.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an exciting, provoking, challenging</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 3, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lacessitor: <entryFree id="n25541" type="main" key="la^cessi_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcessītor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25541.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a provoker, challenger</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 10</bibl> in Litt. L.</sense></entryFree>
lacessitus: <entryFree id="n25542" type="main" key="la^cessi_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcessītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from lacesso.</entryFree>
lacesso: <entryFree id="n25543" type="main" key="la^cesso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcesso</orth>, <itype>īvi or ĭi, ītum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n25543.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. pass.</hi> lacessiri, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:8:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:15:4" default="NO">9, 15, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacessi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:18:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 18, 4 al.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacessientium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 12, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacessiebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:46:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 46, 11</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>lacio; v. Roby, 1, § 625</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to excite, provoke, challenge, exasperate, irritate</hi> (syn.: irrito, provoco). </sense><sense id="n25543.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:31:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 31, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponsione me homo promtus lacessivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:23:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 23, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu ultro me maledictis lacessisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me amabis et scripto aliquo lacesses,</quote> <trans><tr>by writing, force me to write in return</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetus si poeta non lacessisset prior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:prol. 14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. prol. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes proelio,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to attack, assail</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
