G. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem bello,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aeduos injuriā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos te nulla lacessiimus injuria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Saguntini nec lacessentes nec lacessiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquos lacessiturus bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 10, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum alter relictus, alter lacessitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tam necessarium quam tenere semper arma, quibus ... to ulcisci lacessitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 8, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne rudis agminum sponsus lacessat leonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar neque cedentes tanto collis ascensu lacessendos judicabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:14" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem capitaliter,</quote> <trans><tr>to make a deadly attack upon one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(corpora) quae feriunt oculorum acies visumque lacessunt,</quote> <trans><tr>to strike, meet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 217</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:691" default="NO" valid="yes">691</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:597" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 597</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nares odor lacessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:691" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 691</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fores nondum reserati carceris acer nunc pede nunc ipsa fronte lacessit Equus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:9:30" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 9, 30</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aëra Sole lacessita ( = percussa radiis solis),</quote> <trans><tr>struck with the sunbeams' glitter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:527" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 527</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vindemia pluviisque aut ventis lacessita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:21:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 21, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25543.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen. </sense><sense id="n25543.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To urge, arouse, excite, stimulate, shake, move</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quo non modo impulsi sumus ad philosophas scriptiones, verum Etiam lacessiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:41:121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 41, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad scribendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad pugnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 45 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usus luxuriantis aetatis signaturas pretiosis gemmis coepit insculpere, et certatim haec omnis imitatio lacessivit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 13, 11</bibl></cit>: aurigae manibusque lacessunt Pectora plausa cavis, <hi rend="ital">pat them on their breasts</hi> (in order to animate them), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 429</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 254</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quemquam voce lacessas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his se stimulis dolor ipse lacessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nilus spuma astra lacessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 320</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taurus lacessit campum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:604" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 604</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamore sidera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:387" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 387</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos (precibus),</quote> <trans><tr>to assail, importune</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 18, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelagus carinā,</quote> <trans><tr>to stir, chafe</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 35, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25543.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To call forth, arouse, produce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lacetani: <entryFree id="n25544" type="main" key="Laceta_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lacetāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25544.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:34" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 34</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lacetānia</orth>, ae <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the</hi> Lacetani, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Ep. Pomp. 5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Ep. Pomp. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 2, 6, § 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lachanisso: <entryFree id="n25545" type="greek" key="la^cha^nisso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăchănisso</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-nīzo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> (<foreign lang="greek">la/xanon</foreign>, olus), = <foreign lang="greek">laxani/zw</foreign>, <sense id="n25545.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be weak, languid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponit betissare pro languere quod vulgo lachanissare dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:87" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 87</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
laches: <entryFree id="n25546" type="main" key="La^che_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăchēs</orth>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25546.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of an old man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1</bibl>, and 2.</sense></entryFree>
lachesis: <entryFree id="n25547" type="main" key="La^che^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăchĕsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*la/xesis</foreign>, <sense id="n25547.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the three Fates</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">o duram Lachesin,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:10:45" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 10, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Apoc. 4:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Apoc. 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:54:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 54, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:27" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:136" default="NO">9, 136</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Gild. 203</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lachrima: <entryFree id="n25548" type="main" key="lachri^ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lachrĭma</orth>, <itype>an old form for lacrima</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:3:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 3, 3</bibl>.</entryFree>
laciades: <entryFree id="n25549" type="main" key="La^ci^a^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăcĭădes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lakia/dhs</foreign>, <sense id="n25549.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one belonging to the Lacian demos</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">district, in Attica</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:18:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 18, 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lacinia: <entryFree id="n25550" type="main" key="la^ci^ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcĭnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>v. lacus, lacer</etym>, <sense id="n25550.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the lappet, flap, edge</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">corner</hi> of a garment. </sense><sense id="n25550.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sume laciniam atque absterge sudorem tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem lacinia tenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in lacinia servare ex mensa secunda semina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fil. Fam. 16, 21, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consurgenti ei primum lacinia obhaesit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 19</bibl></cit>: togae, id. <pb n="1027" /> <cb n="LACO" /> Calig. 35; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25550.2" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a garment</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">detraxit umeris laciniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0972,001:12" default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> S. 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 138</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6</bibl>, p. 174; 11, p. 263; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Thren. 4, 14</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n25550.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25550.4" n="1" level="3"> Of cattle, <hi rend="ital">the dewlap</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laciniae dependentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 50, 76, § 202</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25550.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A small piece</hi> or <hi rend="ital">part</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">porrum et allium serunt in laciniis colligatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 7, 36, § 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 30, 39, § 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gregem in lacinias distribuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, also, <hi rend="ital">a small strip</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spot of land</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam id oppidum velut in lacinia erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 43, § 148</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 13, 19, § 85</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25550.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: aliquid obtinere laciniā, <hi rend="ital">by the lappet</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">hardly, with difficulty, without a firm hold upon it</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:28:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 28, 110</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
laciniatim: <entryFree id="n25551" type="hapax" key="la^ci^ni^a_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcĭnĭātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>lacinia</etym>, <sense id="n25551.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">piecemeal, in small divisions</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 208, 20, p. 175</bibl> Bip.</sense></entryFree>
laciniose: <entryFree id="n25552" type="main" key="la^ci^ni^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcĭnĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. laciniosus <sense id="n25552.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
laciniosus: <entryFree id="n25553" type="main" key="la^ci^ni^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcĭnĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lacinia</etym>, <sense id="n25553.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of folds, full of lappets, full of corners, projections</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">indentations, indented, jagged</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n25553.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">metatus est Eam (urbem) ... ad effigiem Macedonicae chlamydis orbe gyrato laciniosam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 10, 11, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis laciniosae pomparum et deliciarum ineptiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cult. Fem. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostrea spondylo brevi, nec fibris lacinioso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 6, 21, § 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 10, 76, § 124</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25553.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, qs., <hi rend="ital">impeded, entangled with lappets</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fringes; overloaded, redundant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi imbecillitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 287, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita et implicita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verg. Vel. 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec Porphyrius sermone laciniosissimo prosecutus est (al. latissimo),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Dan. 11, 22</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcĭnĭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">like lappets, with lappets</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 43, 83, § 226</bibl> (al. lacunosa est).</sense></entryFree>
lacinium: <entryFree id="n25554" type="main" key="La^ci_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăcīnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*laki/nion</foreign>, <sense id="n25554.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a promontory in Magna Græcia, near Crotona, with a temple to Juno</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Capo delle Colonne</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Cape Nao</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:42" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 10, 15, § 96</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n25554.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăcīnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Lacinium, Lacinian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:24:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 24, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 107, 111, § 240</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:64" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 9, 36, § 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">diva,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Juno</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:552" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 552</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:701" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 701</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lacio: <entryFree id="n25555" type="gloss" key="la^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcĭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>v. laqueus</etym>, <sense id="n25555.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to entice, allure</hi>: lacit, in fraudem inducit. Inde est allicere et lacessere; inde lactat, illectat, delectat, oblectat, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=117" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 117</bibl> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lacit, decipiendo inducit. Lax etenim fraus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> p. 116.</sense></entryFree>
laco: <entryFree id="n25556" type="main" key="La^co_^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăcō^</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăcon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*la/kwn</foreign>, <sense id="n25556.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Laconian, Lacedæmonian, Spartan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen et regnata petam Laconi rura Phalanto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Laconis illud dictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:14:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 14, 40</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Laconis illa vox,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 46, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quo cum Laco pecuniam numeratum accepisset,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Agesilaüs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Tim. 1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Tim. 1, 12</bibl></cit>.—Also of the <hi rend="ital">Spartan dogs</hi>, which (like the Newfoundland dogs with us) were famed for their strength and vigilance: <cit><quote lang="la">Molossus, aut fulvus Lacon, Amica vis pastoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:6:5" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 6, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 219</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:2:95" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 2, 95</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăcōnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Laconians, Lacedæmonians, Spartans</hi>: consiliis nostris laus est attonsa Laconum, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:17:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 17, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 14</bibl> (4, 13), 33.—Also of <hi rend="ital">Castor and Pollux</hi>, the sons of the Spartan, Leda: <cit><quote lang="la">Ledaei Lacones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:37:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 37, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:4:11" default="NO">9, 4, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidus Laconum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Spect. 26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Spect. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ei notus amor provexit in castra Laconas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Idyll. 7, 37</bibl></cit>.—Comically, of <hi rend="ital">parasites</hi>, for their endurance of humiliations: <cit><quote lang="la">nil morantur jam Lacones imi supselli viros, plagipatidas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25556.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n25556.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăcōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a country of the Peloponnesus, of which Sparta</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">Lacedæmon, was the capital city</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 34, 39, § 214</bibl> (al. Laconicam); 17, 18, 30, § 133; called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăcōnĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lakwnikh</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:3:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:94 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 53, § 94 al.</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăcōnĭ-cē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Tim. 2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Tim. 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 4</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n25556.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăcōnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lakwniko/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Laconia, Laconian, Lacedæmonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: clavem mi harunc aedium Laconicam jam jube efferri intus; hasce ego aedis occludam hanc foris, <hi rend="ital">a key made with peculiar skill, one which fastened a lock trom without</hi> (whereas others closed it <cb n="LACR" /> only from within), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 57</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Guhl & Koner, Life of Greeks and Romans, p. 465: purpurae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 18, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 63, 83, § 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:8" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăcōnĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. balnium), <hi rend="ital">a sweating-room, a sweating-bath</hi>, first used by the Lacedæmonians, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1 praef" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1 praef.</bibl> § 16.—</sense><sense id="n25556.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lă-cōnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lakwni/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Laconian, Lacedæmonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">matre Laconide nati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 223</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> for Laconia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lacobriga: <entryFree id="n25557" type="main" key="Lacobri^ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lacobrĭga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n25557.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Lusitania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 3, 6</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lacobrĭgenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Lacobriga</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lacotomus: <entryFree id="n25558" type="greek" key="la^co^to^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcŏtŏmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lako/tomos</foreign>, <sense id="n25558.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a straight line which cuts the equator</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 8</bibl> (but v. laeotomus).</sense></entryFree>
lacrima: <entryFree id="n25559" type="main" key="la_^cri^ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lā^crĭma</orth> (archaic <orth extent="full" lang="la">lacrŭma</orth>, <itype>not lacryma</itype>, lachryma; old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">dacrĭma</orth>, freq. in Livius Andronicus, acc. to Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=68" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 68</bibl> Müll.; <sense id="n25559.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> the letter <ref targOrder="U">D</ref></xr>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dacru-ma, kindred with Gr. <foreign lang="greek">da/kru</foreign>; Sanscr. asru for dasru; Goth. tah-ja; Engl. tear; Germ. Zaehre; cf. the Sanscr. root dans and Gr. <foreign lang="greek">da/k-nw</foreign>, to bite</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a tear</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25559.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: meae in quem lacrumae guttatim cadunt, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 116, 1</bibl> (Trag. v. 238 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">miserae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> (Trag. v. 168 id.): <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimas effundere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cito arescit lacrima, praesertim in alienis malis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:17:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 17, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimas dare ignoto,</quote> <trans><tr>to shed a tear, to weep for</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:720" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 720</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrumas mi haec, quom video, eliciunt, quia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut mi excivisti lacrumas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homini lacrumae cadunt quasi puero gaudio,</quote> <trans><tr>tears fall from his eyes for joy, he sheds tears of joy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimis oculos suffusa nitentes,</quote> <trans><tr>her brilliant eyes moistened with tears</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque prae lacrimis jam loqui possum,</quote> <trans><tr>cannot speak for tears</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:38:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 38, 105</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:41:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 41, 99</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimas non tenere,</quote> <trans><tr>not withhold tears, not restrain them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:67:section=172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 67, § 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tradere se lacrimis et tristitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimis confici,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis cum lacrimis obsecrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manantibus prae gaudio lacrimis,</quote> <trans><tr>shedding tears of joy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:8:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimis semper paratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:273" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 273</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrumae confictae dolis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diu cohibitae lacrimae prorumpunt,</quote> <trans><tr>tears long restrained break forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatiscere in lacrimas,</quote> <trans><tr>to dissolve in tears</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:395" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 395</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrumis opplet os totum sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimas effundere,</quote> <trans><tr>to shed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 126</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:42:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 42, 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">profundere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:17:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 17, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,026:14:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jud. 14, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mittere,</quote> <trans><tr>to let flow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 76:20" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 76, 20</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">but lacrimas mitte,</quote> <trans><tr>away with tears</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimae siccentur protinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:16:27" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 16, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:370" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 370</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ciere,</quote> <trans><tr>to cause to flow</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 468</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">movere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:77" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commovere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:5:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per lacrimas effundere bilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:159" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ciere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:468" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 468</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrumas excussit mihi,</quote> <trans><tr>forced from me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis talia fando temperet a lacrimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abstersis lacrimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:5:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">absterget Deus omnem lacrymam ab oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 7, 17</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc illae lacrumae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 99</bibl></cit>; imitated by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:25:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 25, 61</bibl>, and <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 41</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inde irae et lacrimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:168" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 168</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25559.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a tear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gum-drop</hi> which exudes from plants: <cit><quote lang="la">narcissi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 6, 5, § 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:24" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 5, 11, § 24</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">vitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23 praef.</bibl></cit> 3, § 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:103" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 103</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lacrimabilis: <entryFree id="n25560" type="main" key="la^cri^ma_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcrĭmābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lacrŭm-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lacrima</etym>. <sense id="n25560.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Worthy of tears, lamentable, mournful</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vixque tenet lacrimas, quia nil lacrimabile cernit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:796" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 796</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 604</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. felix, Am. Vict. Epit. 42, 15: nomen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> I. Cons. Stil. 2, 261</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25560.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Tear-like</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">destillatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <trans><tr>tearful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 6, 20</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimabilior series,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl></cit>, Serm. 17, 2: quid lacrimabilius hac stultitia, Salv. Gub. Dei, 6.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcrĭmābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with tears, mournfully</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 140, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lacrimabundus: <entryFree id="n25561" type="main" key="la^cri^ma_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcrĭmābundus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lacrŭm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lacrimo</etym>, <sense id="n25561.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bursting into tears, with tears, weeping</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:46:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 46, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> de Mort. Pers. 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lacrimatio: <entryFree id="n25562" type="main" key="la^cri^ma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcrĭmātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lacrŭm-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <cb n="LACT" /> <sense id="n25562.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a weeping</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25562.1" n="I" level="1"> Esp. as a disease: <cit><quote lang="la">oculo rum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23 praef.</bibl></cit> 5, § 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 54, § 147</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n25562.2" n="II" level="1"> In gen.: lacrimatio et fletus, Vulg Tob. 3, 22.</sense></entryFree>
lacrimo: <entryFree id="n25563" type="main" key="la_^cri^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lā^crĭmo</orth> (arch. <orth extent="full" lang="la">lacrŭmo</orth>; not lacry-), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">lacrĭmor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>lacrima</etym>, <sense id="n25563.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shed tears, to weep</hi> (syn.: fleo, ploro; class.). </sense><sense id="n25563.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25563.2" n="(a)" level="5"> Form lacrimo: <cit><quote lang="la">ne lacruma, patrue,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequeo quin lacrumem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te lacrimasse moleste ferebam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 27, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:39:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 39, 93</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrumo gaudio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tu igitur lacrumas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 3, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrumo, quae posthac futura'st vita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecquis fuit quin lacrimaret?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:46:section=121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 46, § 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia oculi sunt tibi lacrumantes, eo rogavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 30</bibl></cit>: flentes, lacrumantes, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 442</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 107 Vahl.); cf. id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 824</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 175 id.): <cit><quote lang="la">oculis lacrimantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:69:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 69, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa super nata lacrimans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:358" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 358</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimandum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 63:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 63, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25563.3" n="(b)" level="5"> Form lacrimor (postclass.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 126" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 126</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Poen. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:3:35" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 3, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:2:10:71" default="NO">2, 10, 71</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Tob. 7, 19 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n25563.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to beweep, bewail, lament</hi> a thing (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">num id lacrumat virgo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 1, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimo quae posthac futura est vita, quom,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Argos exsequiis lacrimandus eat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:99" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 99</bibl></cit> (but illacrimarit is the true reading, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,007:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alc. 6, 4</bibl>); cf. also the foll. no.—</sense><sense id="n25563.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to weep, drop, distil</hi>, of plants which exude a gum (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimantes calami,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 14, 24, § 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimat sua gaudia palmes, Ven. Carm. 3, 9, 18: lacrimatas cortice myrrhas,</quote> <trans><tr>dropped, distilled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:339" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 339</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lacrimose: <entryFree id="n25564" type="main" key="la^cri^mo_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcrĭmōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. lacrimosus <sense id="n25564.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
lacrimosus: <entryFree id="n25565" type="main" key="la^cri^mo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcrĭmōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lacrŭm-, lacrym-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lacrima</etym>, <sense id="n25565.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of tears, tearful, weeping</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n25565.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumina (i. e. oculi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:8:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 8, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:38:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 38, 6, 17, § 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25565.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That excites to tears, lamentable, doleful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 80</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">caepis odor lacrimosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 6, 32, § 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Trojae funera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 8, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 21, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <trans><tr>plaintive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:1:35" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëmata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25565.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">weeping, dropping, exuding</hi>.—<hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, of plants: <cit><quote lang="la">vites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 28, 47, § 261</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, of the sap: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimosum electrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 434</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 364</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcrĭmō-sē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with tears</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lacrimula: <entryFree id="n25566" type="main" key="la^cri^mu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcrĭmŭla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-mŏla</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25566.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little tear, crocodile-tear</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">haec verba una me hercule falsa lacrimola, Quam oculos terendo misere vix vi expresserit, Restinguet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo lacrimulam, sed multas lacrimas videre potuisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:31:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 31, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frustrantur falsis gaudia lacrimulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lacruma: <entryFree id="n25567" type="main" key="la^cru^ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcrŭma</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcryma</orth>, with their derivv., v. lacrima, etc.</entryFree>
lacta: <entryFree id="n25568" type="main" key="lacta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lacta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n25568.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of cassia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 19, 43, § 97</bibl>; al. lada.</sense></entryFree>
lactaneus: <entryFree id="n25569" type="main" key="lacta_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lactānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lac</etym>, <sense id="n25569.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">milk-like, milky</hi>: color, Th. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 4, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lactans: <entryFree id="n25570" type="main" key="lactans1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lactans</orth>, <sense id="n25570.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P.</hi> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, of lacto, q. v.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25571" type="main" key="Lactans2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lactans</orth>, <itype>ntis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>lac</etym>, <sense id="n25571.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the god of milky growth in corn</hi>: Lactantem deum esse qui se infundit segetibus, et eas facit lactescere, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Verg. G. 1:315" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Verg. G. 1, 315</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lactantius: <entryFree id="n25572" type="main" key="Lactanti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lactantĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, with the surname Firmianus, <sense id="n25572.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated father of the Church in the beginning of the fourth century of the Christian era, famous for the purity of his Latin style, and sometimes called the Christian Cicero</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> de Vir. Ill. 80</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 84, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
lactaris: <entryFree id="n25573" type="main" key="lacta_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lactāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lac</etym>, <sense id="n25573.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">suckling</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">capra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lactarius: <entryFree id="n25574" type="main" key="lacta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lactārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25574.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to milk, containing milk, milky; made of milk</hi> or <hi rend="ital">with milk</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25574.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: lactaria columna in foro holitorio dicta, quod ibi infantes lacte alendos deferebant, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=88" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <trans><tr>milk-weed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 39, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <trans><tr>food prepared with milk</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mons,</quote> <trans><tr>a hill in Campania, famous for its pasture</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 11, 10 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>—So, <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lactārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">milkfood</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 26</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">lactārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a preparer of milk-food</hi>, Lampr. Heliog <pb n="1028" /> <cb n="LACT" /> 27, 3.—Also, <hi rend="ital">a seller of milk</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">galaktopw/lhs</foreign>, Gloss. Labb.—</sense><sense id="n25574.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">suckling, giving suck</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lactatum: <entryFree id="n25575" type="main" key="lacta_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lactātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>lac</etym>, <sense id="n25575.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drink made of milk</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lactatum est potio e lacte,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 3, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lacte: <entryFree id="n25576" type="main" key="lacte"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lacte</orth>, v. lac <sense id="n25576.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
lacteo: <entryFree id="n25577" type="main" key="lacte^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lactĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype> (used almost exclusively in the <sense id="n25577.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part. pres.</hi>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>lac</etym>. </sense><sense id="n25577.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To suck milk, to be a suckling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romulus parvus atque lactens, uberibus lupinis inhians,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 8, 19</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">lactens Juppiter puer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:41:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 41, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:624" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 624</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 227</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lactens hostia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:12:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 12, 29</bibl></cit>; also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lactentibus rem divinam facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 3</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">viscera lactentia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>sucking children, sucklings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:137" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 137</bibl></cit>.—Of the spring: <cit><quote lang="la">tener et lactens (sc. annus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 201</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n25577.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To contain milk</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sap, to be milky, sappy, juicy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verno tempore, cum lactent novella virentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nam sata, vere novo, teneris lactentia sucis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:351" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 351</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenta in viridi stipula lactentia turgent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 315</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lactuca lactens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 7, 26, § 67</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lactentĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">milk-food, milk-dishes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lacteolus: <entryFree id="n25578" type="main" key="lacte^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lactĕŏlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n25578.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [lacteus], <hi rend="ital">white as milk, milk-white</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">puellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:55:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 55, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viscus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 7, 46</bibl></cit>: agni, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 11, 245.</sense></entryFree>
lacteris: <entryFree id="n25579" type="main" key="lacteris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lacteris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n25579.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 111</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lactes: <entryFree id="n25580" type="main" key="lactes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lactes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype> (in <number>sing.</number> lactis, is, only, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 686</bibl>, erroneously on account of lactis agninas), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root lag-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">lagaro/s</foreign>; cf. Lat. languidus, laxus</etym>, <sense id="n25580.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the intestines;</hi> esp. <hi rend="ital">the smaller intestines, chitterlings</hi> (anteclass. and post - Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ab hoc ventriculo lactes in homine et ove, per quas labitur cibus: in ceteris hillae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 79, § 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita cibi vocivitate venio lassis lactibus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>empty, famished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulmone et lactibus unctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:30" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 30</bibl></cit>. —Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">adligare canem fugitivom agninis lactibus, said of the employment of a trifling remedy for a great evil,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 85</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lactesco: <entryFree id="n25581" type="main" key="lactesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lactesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n25581.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [lacteo]. * </sense><sense id="n25581.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To turn to milk</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis fere cibus matrum lactescere incipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:51:128" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 51, 128</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:230 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 21, 84, § 230 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n25581.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To have milk for suckling, to become capable of giving suck</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">asinae praegnantes continuo lactescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 41, 96, § 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 150" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">segetes facit lactescere,</quote> <trans><tr>to become milky</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 1, 315</bibl></cit>; v. 2. Lactans.</sense></entryFree>
lacteus: <entryFree id="n25582" type="main" key="lacte^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lactĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lac</etym>. <sense id="n25582.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of milk, milky; full of milk</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n25582.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">umor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:525" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 525</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25582.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">milk-drinking, sucking</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vernae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:58:22" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 58, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:47:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 47, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25582.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">milk-white, milkcolored, milky</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">colla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:660" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 660</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervix,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:45:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 45, 2</bibl></cit>: circulus, the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">galaci/as ku/klos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the Milky Way</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:16:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 16, 16</bibl>; also, <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 168</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25582.4" n="B" level="2"> Illa Livi lactea ubertas, <hi rend="ital">pure</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lacticinium: <entryFree id="n25583" type="hapax" key="lacti^ci_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lactĭcīnĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25583.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">milk-food, food prepared with milk</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:7:11" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 7, 11</bibl>.—Also, ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">lactĭcīnĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ōrum</orth>) <foreign lang="greek">w)o/gala</foreign> (<hi rend="ital">a dish prepared with milk and eggs</hi>), Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
lacticolor: <entryFree id="n25584" type="hapax" key="lacti^co^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lactĭcŏlor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lac-color</etym>, <sense id="n25584.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">milkcolored</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 7, 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lacticularius: <entryFree id="n25585" type="gloss" key="lacti^cula_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lactĭculārĭus</orth>, ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">lactĭculōsus</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">lipoga/laktos</foreign>, <sense id="n25585.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deprived of milk</hi> (also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>), Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
lactidiacus: <entryFree id="n25586" type="gloss" key="lacti^di^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lactĭdĭăcus</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">lelaktisme/nos</foreign> (<sense id="n25586.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that kicks</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">that has been wounded by kicking</hi>), Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
lactifer: <entryFree id="n25587" type="gloss" key="lacti^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lactĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lac-fero</etym>, <sense id="n25587.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">milk-bringing, producing milk</hi>: Silvanus, Inscr. ap. Mur. 70, 6.</sense></entryFree>
lactilago: <entryFree id="n25588" type="main" key="lacti^la_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lactĭlāgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>lac</etym>, <sense id="n25588.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, called also chamaedaphne, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lactineus: <entryFree id="n25589" type="hapax" key="lacti^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lactĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25589.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">milk-colored, white</hi>, Ven. Carm. 8, 1, 27.</sense></entryFree>
lactis: <entryFree id="n25590" type="main" key="lactis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lactis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. lactes.</entryFree>
lactito: <entryFree id="n25591" type="main" key="lacti^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lactĭto</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>1. lacto</etym>, <sense id="n25591.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to give suck, to suckle</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), Ps.-<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:102:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 102, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lacto: <entryFree id="n25592" type="main" key="lacto1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lacto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum</itype> (used almost exclusively in the <sense id="n25592.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part. pres.</hi>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>lac</etym>. </sense><sense id="n25592.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To contain milk, to have milk, to give suck</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubera lactantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:342" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 342</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 321</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:885" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 885</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubera quae non lactaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:23:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 23, 29</bibl></cit>: quaecunque (femina) id <cb n="LACU" /> temporis lactans est, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 1, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25592.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To suck milk, to take the breast, to suck</hi>: puer lactans, Liv. Andron. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 153, 26</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 38 Rib.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">infans lactavit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epit. 32</bibl></cit>: anni lactantes, <hi rend="ital">the suckling years</hi> (of a child), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Idyll. 4, 67</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25592.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To be full of milk, to be milky</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">metae,</quote> <trans><tr>cheeses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:43:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 43, 7</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">meta lactis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:58:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 58, 35</bibl></cit>).—<mood>Part.</mood> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lactantia</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">milky food</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:28:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 28, 2 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n25592.4" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to give suck to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lactaverunt catulos suos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Thren. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filium suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Reg. 1, 23</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lactare ut nutriaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Enarr. in Psa. 130:12" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Enarr. in Psa. 130, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mamilla regum lactaberis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:60:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 60, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25593" type="main" key="lacto2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lacto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>lacio</etym>, <sense id="n25593.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to allure, wheedle, flatter, deceive with fair words, to dupe, cajole</hi> (mostly ante-class.): dictis lenibus lactare aliquem, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 16, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frustrando lactans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita me amor lapsum animi ludificat...retinet, lactat largitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 1, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si te lactaverint peccatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec lactes quemquam labiis tuis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 24, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lactoris: <entryFree id="n25594" type="main" key="lacto^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lactŏris</orth>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>lac</etym>, <sense id="n25594.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of milky plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 18, 104, § 168</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lactosus: <entryFree id="n25595" type="gloss" key="lacto_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lactōsus</orth>, = <foreign lang="greek">galaktw/dhs</foreign>, <sense id="n25595.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">milk-like, milky</hi>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
lactuca: <entryFree id="n25596" type="main" key="lactu_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lactūca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>lac</etym>. <sense id="n25596.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Lettuce</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 38, § 125</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:179" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 179</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:25" default="NO">11, 3, 25</bibl> sq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> M. 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:14:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 14, 1</bibl>; several species are described by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:H. N. 20:7:24:section=58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> H. N. 20, 7, 24, § 58</bibl> sqq.—</sense><sense id="n25596.1" n="II" level="1"> Lactuca marina, <hi rend="ital">the plant wolf's-milk</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:15:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 15, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lactucarius: <entryFree id="n25597" type="gloss" key="lactu_ca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lactūcārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25597.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dealer in lettuce</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 313</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
lactucinus: <entryFree id="n25598" type="main" key="Lactu_ci_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lactūcīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>lactuca</etym>, <sense id="n25598.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname in the</hi> familia Valeria, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 4, 19, § 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lactucosus: <entryFree id="n25599" type="gloss" key="lactu_co_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lactūcōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of lettuce</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 316</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
lactucula: <entryFree id="n25600" type="main" key="lactu_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lactūcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25600.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small, young lettuce</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:111" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:77" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 77</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lacturcia: <entryFree id="n25601" type="main" key="Lacturci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lacturcĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>lac</etym>, <sense id="n25601.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a goddess who presided over the corn swelling with milk</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 8 (al. deum Lacturnum); cf. 2. Lactans.</sense></entryFree>
lacturnus: <entryFree id="n25602" type="main" key="Lacturnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lacturnus</orth>, <itype>l</itype>, <sense id="n25602.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the preced.</ref></xr> art.</sense></entryFree>
laculatus: <entryFree id="n25603" type="main" key="la^cu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lacus</etym>, <sense id="n25603.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">four-cornered, checkered</hi>: vestis, <hi rend="ital">woven in square compartments</hi> or <hi rend="ital">checks, with inwoven or embroidered pictures</hi> (v. lacus, V.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 22, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lacuna: <entryFree id="n25604" type="main" key="la^cu_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcūna</orth> (collateral form <orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭcūna</orth>; cf. Lachm. ad Lucr. vol. 2, p. 205; <orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcūnā-tūra</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 15, p. 351, 2</bibl> Hildebrand; <sense id="n25604.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>lacus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a ditch, pit, hole;</hi> esp. a place where water collects, <hi rend="ital">a pool, pond</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25604.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): lacuna, id est aquae collectio, a lacu derivatur, quam alii lamam, alii lustrum dicunt, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=117" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 117</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">vastae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:552" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 552</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vastae Orci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 116</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:538" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 538</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 117</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 365</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">salsae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the sea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:794" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 794</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1044" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 1044</bibl>; also, <cit><quote lang="la">Neptuniae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 10, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caecas lustravit luce lacunas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=431" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 431</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25604.2" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a hollow, cavity, opening, chasm, cleft</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum supercilia cana, et sub ea lacunae, dicunt, eum equum habere annos sedecim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:29:3" default="NO">1, 29, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">atque lacunarum fuerant vestigia cuique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1261</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">labrum superius sub ipsa medietate narium lacuna quadam levi, quasi valle, signavit deus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Op. D. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genae teretes ac medio mento lacuna,</quote> <trans><tr>a dimple</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 351</bibl></cit> (Hildebr., lacunatura).—</sense><sense id="n25604.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a gap, void, defect, want, loss</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">est, qui expleas duplicem istam lacunam,</quote> <trans><tr>to fill up the double void</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:28" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut illam lacunam rei familiaris expleant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:55:section=138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 55, § 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacuna in auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa labes et quasi lacuna famae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:3:23" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 3, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lacunar: <entryFree id="n25605" type="main" key="la^cu_nar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcūnar</orth>, <itype>āris</itype> (<case>nom.</case> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lacūnārĭum</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 15, 8, 6</bibl>; <sense id="n25605.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> lacunariorum for lacunarium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:3:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 3, 1 al.</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">dat. plur.</hi> lacunariis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 2</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>lacuna</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a wainscoted and gilded ceiling</hi> of an unvaulted chamber, <hi rend="ital">a panel-ceiling, a ceiling</hi> (so called from its sunken spaces; <cit><quote lang="la">class.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ebur neque aureum Mea renidet in domo lacunar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladium e lacunari seta equina aptum demitti jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:21:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 21, 62</bibl></cit>: primus lacunaria pingere<cb n="LADA" />  instituit (Polygnotus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 124</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">spectare lacunar,</quote> <trans><tr>to gaze at the ceiling, to be wilfully blind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:56" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 56</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25605.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcūnārĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype> (-arium, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 18, p. 83</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">panels of the under surface of a cornice</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 124</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
